loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Ms Farzana is 30 years old and has been doing a hand embroidery business for five years. She makes beautiful patterns of embroidery for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to gain a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. Farzana is a mother of four, three of whom are going to school.  She needs to improve her earnings to cover the expenses of her children.  For this reason, she has requested a loan of RS. 25,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beats, sequins and stones for embellishing. In this way, she will be able to serve more customers consistently. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Farzana dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beats, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en:
Freda believes that "a hard working person will become successful." She is 47 years old and has three school-aged children. Her ambition in life is to become successful in order to give her children a bright future. Freda owns and manages a small variety store in her village while her husband works at a private company. They help each other to finance their children's education. They hope that their children will all earn a degree and become professionals someday.

Freda aims to improve her variety store to earn sufficient income but due to inadequate capital she is asking for an additional 30,000 PHP to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, junk food, candies, soaps, beverages and soft drinks to sell. Despite problems and difficulties in life, Freda believes that she will make the business viable and profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, junk food, candies, soaps, beverages and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.en: Andres is 52 years old and married to Carmelita. To earn a living, Andres is engaged in his general store. He has been running his business for five years. He usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Right now, Andres wants to have more groceries to sell, which is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads and condiments to sell. He plans to save more from his income for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, assorted breads and condiments to sell

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 56-year-old active lady and a mother of four. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner.. With the passage of time, her sales increased, along with her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in both family matters and financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for higher studies. She has some savings and applied a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a responsible housewife who is engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 46 years old and is blessed with four siblings. They are raising their family in a rural community where they are able to plant rice and vegetables and raise livestock for sale.

Due to the high costs of school fees, she aims to improve the business to generate a higher income. However, because of financial difficulties Nelly is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise and materials needed to improve the pigpen. She believes that this loan will enable her to improve the business and she is hoping that she will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets to raise and materials needed to improve the pigpen.

loans.name: Rasulan

texts.en:
Ms. Rasulan is a 47-year-old married woman. She has been running a milk sales business for five years. She looks after her buffaloes and collects milk every day. She serves her community well, as most of her clients are neighbors. She makes enough to fulfill the needs of her family members. Because of her work, Ms. Rasulan is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters including financial matters.

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got from building another room for her children. She hopes to improve her earnings so she can again apply for a loan of 20,000 PKR. She will combine the loan amount with her past savings to buy another buffalo. Ms. Rasulan is hoping to cater to more customers through her large sales and wants to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business to the local market.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo, 52, is married and has two children. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen in the market. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for fourteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a day for these activities. Now, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell. Leonardo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase meat and vegetables to cook and sell,

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 38-years-old, married and blessed with 5 children. She is married to a farmer, and they live happily in a rural community. Due to financial difficulty, she helps her husband in generating income for the sake of their family. She engages in hog-raising to generate additional income. She aims to improve the business and make it a viable source of income. To improve the business, she is asking for an additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business, and she hopes that she will become successful in working out her plans.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Ms. Nargis is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of 4. She is a talented lady who excels at sewing and has six years of experience in this field. She knows sewing techniques very well and serves well in her community. Ms. Nargis wants to fulfill the needs of her family through all of her hard work.  She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy a new sewing machine with reels of threads, buttons and zippers in different colors. She requires these items in order to meet increasing demand without delay. With the purchase of this new machine, her daughter will be able to assist her in completing orders on time. She dreams of her children's bright future and desires to build her own house, as she is currently living in a rented house with her family.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with reels of threads, buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en: Amor is 40 years old and has chosen to be single. His ambition in life is to become successful and financially stable by running a viable business in order to generate sufficient income. In addition to managing farm lots, he also started a piggery to raise pigs for sale. He has been in this business for almost 28 years and usually uses his income to buy necessities for himself and support the education of his nephew and nieces. He aims to earn and save more income in order to expand his business and continue sending his nephew and nieces to school. To expand the business, he is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising. He is hoping that that some day he will expand the business and make it more viable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for hog-raising.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel lives peacefully with his loving wife and two children. He has devoted six years of sacrifices and patience to his rice field. Having devoted this long period of time, he is able to increase his yields every crop season.

Manuel decided to continue developing his rice crop production, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to allow him to buy the necessary fertilizer and insecticide to ensure the good growth of his rice crops. In this way, he will be able to obtain a greater income for his family's needs and the education of his two children. Manuel believes that his goal in life will someday be realized, because he has been doing his best in his rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his rice farming business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry, 40, is married and has six children. He has managed his rice field for eight years. His main goal is to improve his rice crop production, for it is the only means to educate his six children and improve their living conditions.

Jerry focuses most of his time on his farming business. He said that this field of business requires hard labor and perseverance. He endures all of the pain and the sun's heat to develop his farm plot to make it more productive.

Jerry would like to ask for additional working capital amount of 25,000 PHP, which will allow him to buy farm supplies such as herbicides, fertilizer and insecticides. Through proper care to his rice crop production, he will be able to earn a better income, which will enable him to provide for his family's basic necessities and save for the bright future of his children.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as herbicides, fertilizers and insecticides his rice crop.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a single parent of two children. Though it's quite hard to act as father and mother, he is still able to manage his farming business and raise his children well.  Aside from farming, he also has a furniture shop as an additional source of income.

Joel manages a hectare of rice field and the furniture shop. Since crop season starts this month, his focus is on his rice field.  He prepares his farm land well so that he can grow healthy rice crops.  Joel is now struggling with a shortage of capital because he used some of his profit for his furniture shop.

With regards to this situation, he is asking for a loan of PHP35,000. This would really be a big help to him because he could purchase the necessary fertilizer and insecticides to ensure the proper growth of his rice crops.  He knows that, through proper plant care, he could also obtain greater profit. 

Joel hopes that his requested loan amount will be granted to him so he can give his children a quality education and a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer and insecticides for his rice field.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Macario

texts.en: Macario is a man who is hard-working and full of hopes. He lives with his wife and four children. His wife manages a retail store while he is in charge in taking care of their rice field. He has worked as a farmer for ten years. He is grateful to God because for a long period of time, he has been able to manage his rice field wisely. Macario and his wife work hand in hand to have a better way of living and give their children a quality education. He is happy and glad because his children are responsible in their daily assigned work at home. He has had a great time cultivating his farm land and keeping it productive. For now, he is asking for additional working capital in the amount of 40,000 PHP. He will be using this loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides, which will help him to reap a plentiful harvest this next crop season.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, insecticides and herbicides for proper growth of his rice crops.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en: Angelito is a hardworking father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 42 years old and has three school-age children. Despite the hardship of living, he aims to uplift their status of living to give his children a better life. Due to insufficient income, he set up a small variety store in their house while his wife presently works in one of the private companies in Nueva Vizcaya. Angelito aims to improve the business to generate sufficient income. He is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks and other beverages, canned goods, soaps, noodles, eggs, junk food, biscuits and seasonings to sell. Through this loan, Angelito believes that he will improve his business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other beverages, canned goods, soaps, noodles, eggs, junk food, biscuits and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Al-Sadh Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sadh. It is a peaceful group that consists of four women from Hodiedh, Yemen. Their main activity is small trade.
Aisha is 40 years old and the mother of six children. She sells clothes to the women of the area.  This new loan will allow her to buy some clothes and to mix various scents. She hopes to open a retail store.

loans.use: to buy some clothes and to mix various scents.

loans.name: Cerelina

texts.en:
Cooking of glutinous rice cakes has been Cerelina’s business for ten years. She cooks four times a week and sells the cakes to the people around her village. Cerelina is 53 years of age and has three children. Her husband is involved in mining activity, in some places in the Philippines. Cerelina knows that her husband's work is risky. She wants to help her husband in just a simple way. Even though her husband's income from his work is enough to sustain their needs, she wants to have her own source of income. She doesn’t want to rely only upon her husband's income. 

Hence, Cerelina is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy ingredients for baking her glutinous rice cakes, which she will sell. She hopes to continue operating the business and helping her husband.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making her glutinous rice cakes to sell.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia got married when she was only 19 years old. She was not given a chance to enter college or even finish her high school level of education. According to her, during this time she instead assisted her father in caring for their family, since her mother got sick and they are nine members in the family.

Since Anastacia got married, she works hard just to feed her children and give them a better way of living. She engaged in a farming business until she realized that life is difficult when there is no other source of income. Anastacia engages herself in the retail and wholesale of beans, garlic and onions. Fifteen years from now, Anastacia wishes to have savings for their future. She wants to raise her profits. To this end, Anastacia is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy garlic, onions and ginger. She will strive to make her wish a reality.

loans.use: to buy garlic, onions and ginger.

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 54 years old.  She is married and has six children. 

Romelita started her business by selling vegetables.  She bought vegetables in the markets and made rounds in their village.  When she got tired of making rounds with her vegetables, she decided to put up a small sari-sari, or general, store in her village.  She has been in business for 20 years.
 
Romelita sells biscuits and beverages.  With her determination to gain additional profits, she also cooks glutinous cake to sell.  Romelita would like to borrow 17,000 PHP in order to buy spices, canned goods and soft drinks for her sari-sari store business.  Romelita hopes to improve the business and increase her profit for her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy spices, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two.  Zahida is motivated to provide for her family. 

She has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. She has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  To expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates.  She says that only then can she meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues for personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Al-Thlathin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Thlathin and consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidh,Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Safia is from Hodiedh, Yemen. She is 35 years old, married and has one child. She is the only provider for the family. She has been selling ice cream. She specializes in her field. She has been operating her business for one year. She has accumulated good experience in this field and a good reputation in her local community.

She started her business with an old fridge which has not been working recently. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy a new fridge. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
Selling of street foods in her village is Dely’s business. She sells barbeque, hotdogs and kikiam, to generate income. (Kikiam is a Filipino dish made with gound pork and vegetables, rolled in a dried tofu sheet and deep-fried, usually served with a dipping sauce.) 

Dely is 57 years old and still single. Aside from selling of street foods in her village, she is also engaged in a hog-raising business. Dely’s goal in life is to help her relatives, especially her niece and nephews in pursuing their education. 

Dely wants to extend the foods she offers to her customers. She wishes for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy meat and ingredients for barbeque-making. She hopes to have more customers, raise her income, and continue supporting her relatives as well.

loans.use: to buy meat and ingredients for making barbeque.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 63 years of age and a widow. To make a living, Lolita engages in a retailing business, which is a sari-sari (convenience) store. Lolita has six children. Four are married, one is abroad, and her youngest child assists her in managing their store.
 
Lolita doesn’t want to rely only upon her child for remittances from abroad. That’s why she keeps on running a sari-sari store. Lolita wanted to extend the products she sells in their village for additional profits. Thus, Lolita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy drinks, biscuits, shampoo and soap, to resell. She will treat her customers well, so that she will raise the number of her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, biscuits, shampoo and soap to resell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Mrs Asima is a 45-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of sewing garments (shirts for gentlemen and children) for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a stitching machine. At present, she enjoys a great customer list, and she has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community and in the local market. 

Asima is a mother of seven children -- one son and six daughters. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small workshop. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income. 

She requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to replace her old stitching machine, and to buy some more spools of thread, buttons and zippers in various colors. With these items she will be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a new stitching machine, and some spools of thread, buttons and zippers, in various colors.

loans.name: Boun

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Boun is a resident of a rural area of the Moung Russey district, Battambang province, Cambodia. Boun is a father of two children. To make a living, he has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for four years, and he earns additional income by running a small barber shop in a village. With his current businesses he earns about 23,000 KHR per day. He manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day, after covering the daily living expenses of his family. 

Boun has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle, and he completely paid back the loan. That loan helped him to relieve his family’s burdens and to improve their livelihood. Now he is asking for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR. Boun is going to use the loan to buy materials to use in his barber business. He hopes to earn more income, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy materials to use in his barber business

loans.name: Rabzana

texts.en:
Rabzana is a 27-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She is a mother of one child. She has been doing a business of machine embroidery for the past three years. She is passionate about her work, and customers' demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is also doing business with her; both make enough to bear their everyday expenditures. Rabzana's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best-earning resource in her household. 

Rabzana wants to grow her business to meet the needs of the family members smoothly. She requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy raw materials, such as various colors of thread, sequins, and pearls, in large quantities to meet the increasing demand for her embroidered textiles. 

She speaks of her dream of running a training center for the girls of her community. She would teach them embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market, to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials in large quantities, to meet the increasing demand for her embroidered textiles.

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en:
Rim is age 44 and married. She lives in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has six children. Three of her children depend on her and are in school. Rim and her husband have been involved in rice farming and sesame planting to earn a living for 23 years. The current business earns them about 22,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs, and she can manage to save about 12,000 KHR per day. The main challenge for her business the lack of working capital to buy fertilizer for applying to her paddy-field.

This is the third loan for Rim with Kiva partner VisionFund. The past loan has helped her with a better living. She is leading her group of four to request another loan. Rim, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to make more income from her current business so as to achieve a standard lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy is a 51-year-old resident of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is married and has five children. She has been engaged in rice farming on two hectares of farmland for 24 years to support her family. Additionally, she also plants sesame on two hectares of farmland for extra income. Phy is able to earn about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. Insufficient working capital is the main challenge for supporting her farming business. 

Phy has had two previous loans with VisionFund and has completely repaid them. The past two loans have helped her to maintain a standard of living for her family. She has now formed a group of three to request a new loan. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to improve her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Men's Group

texts.en:
Men is 45 years old, and he has two children, both of whom are dependent on him and in school. He is a villager from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. He supplements his income by raising pigs. He has been in this business for thirteen years. He earns approximately 11,000 KHR per day from the current business, and he can manage to save about 6,000 KHR each day. 

Men’s group consists of two members, who have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle. They successfully paid back the prior loan. Men is leading the group to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Men is going to use his portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for his farmland and to buy piglets for raising. Men hopes to increase his income so as to improve his family's living conditions, and to keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for rice, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Chiv's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Chiv is a 38-year-old, married mother of three kids, all still in school. She has been in rice and sesame farming for ten years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day, after daily living expenses. Lack of working capital is the main challenge for her operating business.    

Chiv’s group consists of two members, and both of them are clients in the first loan cycle with VisionFund. Chiv is now leading her group to seek a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, each person. As the leader, Chiv is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes her cash crop thrives and she earns more profit, in order to keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been doing a business of stitching clothes with her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Parveen’s husband. Her husband is a well-known tailor in their community and has gained a lot of experience in this field.

Four years ago, Parveen decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. She also stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. Both are doing it together happily for the sake of their family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, Parveen is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed 20,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR) from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a better source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw material, including cloth, spools of threads in different colors, packs of  laces, and zippers.

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
Hou, age 58, lives in a wooden house in a village in the Moung Russey District, and he is widowed. He has four children. Rice farming and corn planting are the main sources of income for his family, which Hou has been doing for 20 years to make a living. The current business earns him about 11,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) and he manages to save about 5,000 KHR.

Hou has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. He is now leading his group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. He hopes to grow his rice more healthfully and timely so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en:
Souy is 47 years old and she has three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She is a villager from a rural area located in the Bakan district of Pursat province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income, which she has been growing on a two-hectare area of farmland for 22 years. She is able to earn about 14,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses.

Souy’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and she is receiving her first microloan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to apply for loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to better her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Sangke district of Cambodia, Mao is 46 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is still in school and dependent on her. To make a living and take care of her children, she sells rice soup in the village while her husband drives a motor-taxi to better support the family. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

Mao has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and has completely repaid the loans. She successfully used the loans from VisionFund to better support her family’s living. She is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy spices for making rice soup and use a portion of it to spend on building a proper store for selling rice soup. She hopes to earn a large income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy spices for making rice soup.

loans.name: Thoen's Group

texts.en:
Thoen is a villager of the Sangke district of Battambng Province, Cambodia.  She is the 32-year-old mother of two children who need her care as they are still in school. 

Thoen has been engaged in rice farming and planting oranges as the primary sources of her income. From the current business, which she has been in for 10 years, she can earn about KHR 21,000 per day, and she manages to save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses. 

Thoen's group consists of three female members.  She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to support her family’s living conditions as well as expand her current business. 

Now, she and her group member are seeking a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer for her plantation. 

Thoern hopes to gain more income so as to make more income to improve her living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Roxanne Joy

texts.en:
Roxanne Joy is 22 years old, married and has one infant child. Due to lack of job opportunities, she runs a small variety store in their village to help her husband in generating income. 

She has been operating the business for almost four years and usually earns a profit of only PHP 6,000. She usually spent her income for their necessities and food supplements for her child. 
 
She aimed to improve the business to generate a higher income. But due to inadequate capital, Roxanne Joy is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, junk food, candies, biscuits, soap, shampoo, beverages, and seasonings for sale. 

Through hard work and perseverance, she believes that she will make the business more viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, junk food, candies, biscuits, soap, shampoo, beverages and seasonings for sale

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Moern, 38, lives in one of the remote areas of the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has six children, one of whom is still dependent on her and still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and lemons as their main source of income. To better feed the family, Moern also sells grocery items. She has been operating both businesses for 10 years, and she is able to save about 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Moern has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other member of her group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Moern fully repaid the past loans that have helped her relieve her family’s burden and support her child’s education. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. Moern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy seeds for her plantation and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a better living and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her plantation and grocery items for resale

loans.name: Chheyvet

texts.en:
Chheyvet, age 31, lives in a rural area in the Ponhea Krek District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has one daughter who is still in school. To support the family, she and her husband have been raising pigs and selling grocery items. They have been in business for ten years.

Chheyvet has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She absolutely repaid the past loan, which has helped relieve her family’s burden and improved their livelihood. 

Now she is asking for another loan of US $1,020 from VisionFund. She wants to use this loan to buy pig feed for her pig business and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to improve her standard of living and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pig business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms. Irshad is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. For the past ten years, she has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has four buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her hard work. 

Now she requested a loan amount of Rs. 30,000. She will be using the loan amount with her past savings to buy one more buffalo to inflate sales. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She intends to utilize the earned profits on providing good and quality food to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to inflate sales.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is a 41-year-old married mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

Sreymom has earned a living by farming rice and raising pigs, while her husband works for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 15,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 5,000 KHR per day after her daily expenses. 

Sreymom’s group has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sreymom's past loan, which she successfully paid back, has relieved the burden on her family. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feed for her pig business. 

Sreymom hopes to increase her income so as to keep making good progress in her lifestyle and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is an industrious mother who runs a small variety store in her community. She is 43 years old and has three school-aged children. With her husband, they are aiming to increase their income to satisfy their necessities and continue sending their children to school.  Despite problems and difficulties in life, Rosie has strong faith and determination to improve the business. She is requesting a loan for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, beverages, noodles, soaps, beverages and seasonings for sale. She is hoping that someday, she will improve the business as she continues to work hard and strive for it.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, junk food, beverages, noodles, soaps, beverages and seasonings for sale

loans.name: Alas

texts.en: Ms. Alas is a 45-year-old widow and has been involved in the business of sewing for seven years. She had a difficult time after her husband's death and decided to work to support her family for a better future. She sews for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. With time she has become well-known in her community and receives orders for special occasions like weddings, festivals, etc.  However, due to a lack of available funds she is unable to meet her customers' orders on time.  She is currently in her 1st cycle and has borrowed 15,000 PKR.  She requires using this loan amount to buy raw material including spools of threads with the packs of laces, buttons and zippers in different colors. She is hopeful to get an increase in her net income which will enable her to meet the daily expenses of her family members.

loans.use: To buy raw material including spools of threads, packs of lace, buttons and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Ms. Aasia is a vigorous 29-year-old married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past five years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support their family well. Aasia's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning source in her household. Aasia is a mother of three children and able to fulfill their basic needs through all her hard work. 

In order to complete orders on time she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities which will enable her to meet with the increasing demand without fail. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls in her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Wend Teldo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSA représente le  groupe WEND TELDO. Mariée, Il est père de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgés à 03mois. Deux(02)  vont  à l’école et il a 05 personnes  en charge.
Mr vend de pagnes DANFANI depuis 15 ans.  Il s’approvisionne à kouritenga et à paglayuiri. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  50 pagnes tissé.
Il  veut renforcer son activité  avec ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son hagard au marché et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa is the leader of the "Wend Teldo" group. He is a married father of four children. The oldest is 11 and the youngest is three months old. Two of them attend school, and he has five people in his care.
Mr. Issa has sold "Danfani" pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) for 15 years. He gets his supplies at Kouritenga and Paglayuiri. His customers include both men and women.
He would like to buy 50 woven pagnes.
He wants to strengthen his business with his profits. Mr. Issa's ambition is to expand his stall at the market and take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy 50 woven pagnes (brightly-printed clothing).

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 23-year-old purposeful young man who lives in Khndzoresk village of Syunik region.Vahe lives with his mother and 27-year-old sister. He works at a local military unit, and together with his family, Vahe is involved in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates wheat. The livestock currently include 8 cows and 35 sheep. Vahe applied for this loan to increase the number of livestock with special milk cows.
This will allow him to gather more milk and sell it in the local markets.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: La socia es Soledad, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. la socia continua dedicándose a la docencia de educación inicial, y paralelamente continua elaborando prendas de vestir, tejidas en lana como bufandas, guantes, gorros chompas etc. y los distribuye de forma directa y a solicitud de sus clientes. Soledad realiza estas actividades hace algunos años y estos le representa su principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Soledad solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lanas de oveja, alpaca, hilos y accesorios para la elaboración de sus prendas.  Soledad se siente agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
texts.en:
Soledad belongs to the communal bank "LOS DIAMANTES" (The Diamonds) in the city of Cusco in Peru. 

The member continues to work as an early years teacher. At the same time, she continues to make items of clothing such as woollen scarves, gloves, hats, jumpers etc. She distributes them directly and at the request of her customers. 

Soledad has been doing this for many years and this is her main source of income and way of providing for her family. 

Soledad requests this loan to buy materials such as sheep and alpaca wools, threads and accessories to make her items. She feels thankful to Kiva for helping her to maintain and strengthen her work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as sheep and alpaca wools, thread and accessories.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La socia es la señora Bertha, ella pertenece al banco comunal “LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. la socia continua dedicándose a la venta de  productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes. Bertha realiza estas actividades hace algunos años y estos le representa su principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Bertha solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite y  bebidas gaseosas.  Bertha se siente agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con el mantenimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
texts.en: Bertha is a member of the “LOS DIAMANTES” communal bank in the city of Cusco – Peru.  She sells primary needs products and has a small grocery store.  She has been doing this for several years and it’s her main source of income for supporting her family.  Bertha is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk, cooking oil, and carbonated drinks.  She is grateful to Kiva for helping her continue and strengthen her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Yanett

texts.es:
La socia Yanett tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno,sopas y tallarin al horno,la socia ya tiene 3 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado ys e compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yanette is 35 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has two children.  She has a restaurant where she serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and prepares dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and baked noodles.  She has had this business for three years and things are going well.  Her dream is to expand her restaurant and is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as meet, chicken, and vegetables.

She is grateful for this loan and promised to repay in on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El socio es el señor Julio Cesar, él pertenece al banco comunal LOS DIAMANTES” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Julio Cesar continúa con su actividad como distribuidor de medicamentos y perfumería a sus clientes que son principalmente las pequeñas farmacias y boticas de la ciudad. Julio Cesar trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante su actividad y de esta manera  algún dia en el futuro poner su propia farmacia, Julio Cesar solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como medicinas y productos de perfumería para capitalizar su comercio. El socio  agradece a KIVA por  el préstamo y por apoyarlo con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de su actividad.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar belongs to the "LOS DIAMANTES" (The Diamonds) communal bank in the city of Cusco in Peru.

Julio Cesar continues his work as a distributor of medicine and perfume to his clients who are mostly small pharmacies and drugstores in the city. Julio Cesar works hard to get ahead in his work and to one day in the future set up his own pharmacy. 

Julio Cesar is requesting this loan to buy more products such as medicine and perfumes to reinvest in his business. The member thanks Kiva for the loan and for the support that has grown and strengthened his work.

loans.use: to buy products such as medicine and perfume

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La socia Ernestina tiene 53 años de edad es viuda y tiene 4 hijos,la socia tiene un negocio de tejidos,la socia teje chompas y luego los vende al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas donde venden chompas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tejidos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas de colores y palitos de tejer.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 53 years old, is a widow, and has four children.  She knits sweaters and then sells them in quantity to different stores.  She works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and has been doing this for five years.  Things are going well for her and she would like to expand her business.  She is asking for this loan to buy different colors of yarn and knitting needles.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 48 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida por lo tanto vende diferentes platos típicos de la región. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los utensilios (ollas, cubiertos, platos y otras cosas más). Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Magda] was born in Cusco and still lives there.  She is 48 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has six children.  She is a member of the “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

She sells typical regional dishes and has been doing this for several years.  On this occasion she needs a loan in order to maintain her utensils (pots, flatware, and other things).  She is grateful to those who help form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to maintain her utensils

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Jacinta del Socorro, es docente de uno de los colegios de la ciudad de León. Sale de su casa a las 12:30 pm e inicia sus labores desde 01:00 pm hasta las  05:45 pm, este  horario de lunes a viernes y los días domingos de 07:00 am a 03:00 pm, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su familia.

Jacinta del Socorro,  utilizara este crédito para gastos de graduación de su hijo y tramites de título.

Jacinta del Socorro, sueña que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales, ya que uno de ellos  ha logrado coronar su carrera la cual se siente muy orgullosa, por que  ella ha sido madre y padre para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jacinta del Socorro is a teacher in one of the schools of the town of León. She leaves her house at 12:30 p.m. and works from 1 p.m. to 5:45 p.m., Monday through Friday. On Sundays she works from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. She's a single mother of three children. She works so she can support her family.
Jacinta del Socorro will use this loan to pay for her son's graduation and diploma registration costs.
Jacinta del Socorro's dream is to see her children become good professionals. One of them has achieved his professional degree and she's very proud of that, because she has been both a mother and a father to her children.

loans.use: to pay for graduation and diploma registration costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Yeiner

texts.es: yeiner es un joven trabajador, el siembra semillas de maiz y las vende a la comunidad y a la Asociacion. necesita de un prestamo por cuatrocientos mil colones (400.000) para comprar semillas, abono granular, herbicias, fungicidas y pagar la mano de obra. esto le permitira poder tener la materia prima necesaria para producir y asi conseguir el dinero necesario para ayudar a su familia en los gastos diarios.
texts.en: Yeiner is a hardworking young man. He sows corn seeds and sells them to the community and to a business association. He needs a loan for 400,000 colones in order to purchase seeds, granular fertilizer, herbicide and fungicide, and to pay for labor. This will allow him to have the supplies he needs for farming and therefore earn the money he needs in order to support his family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo es un  señor de 65   años de edad, el necesita de otro prestamo para seguir sembrando la semilla de jengibre y asi poder mantener a su familia. es por eso que solicita de trecientos mil colones (₡300.000) para comprar la semilla, los herbicidas y pagar la mano de obra. el esta muy agradecido por poder contar con este prestamo y asi tener una cosecha prospera.
texts.en:
Domingo is a 65 year old man. He needs another loan to be able to keep sowing ginger seeds to be able to provide for his family. 

For this reason, he is requesting ₡300.000 (CRC) to buy seed, weed killers and pay his workers. 

He is very grateful that he can count on this loan and therefore have a prosperous harvest.

loans.use: to buy seed and labour

loans.name: Katy Nathali

texts.es:
La socia Katy Nathali tiene 43 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de radio por internet,la socia tambien trabaja en el area de turismo como operador,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de radio por internet.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo para implementar su negocio de radio.

La socia esta feliz con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con las cuotas.
texts.en:
Katy Nathali is 43 years old. She's married and has two children. The member runs an internet radio business and also works in the tourism field as a tour operator. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Her dream is to expand her internet radio business. The member requests the loan in order to purchase a piece of equipment for implementing her radio business.
The member is glad to obtain the loan and she pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase equipment in order to implement her radio business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en esta misma ciudad, ella tiene 24 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida específicamente ceviche, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante donde expende su comida. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como limón, cebolla, pescado y otros ingredientes. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Cristina] was born in Cusco and lives in the same city.  She is 24 years old, is in a common law marriage and has a son.  She is a member of the “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank of the “Asociación Arariwa.”

She prepares food, specifically ceviche and has a small restaurant where she sells her food.  She’s had this business for several years and things are going well for her.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as lemons, onions, fish, and other ingredients.  She is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
El socio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 26 años de edad es soltero y no tiene hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar de forma independiente en la construcción de obras, él es albañil de profesión y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal desea comprar una computadora. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the city of Cusco where he still lives. He's 26 years old, single with no children. He belongs to the "Anna Jarvis III" communal bank which is part of the Arariwa Association. 

He works mainly freelance in construction. He is a builder by profession and is doing well. 

On this occasion he is requesting the loan for personal use as he wants to buy a computer. He thanks all those who, through this loan, are becoming part of his dream and promises to meet repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Calca pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 34 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar para una entidad pública en el área de mantenimiento. Ya son varios años que trabaja para el estado y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar vinos y panetones pues va vender en época navideña. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the city of Calca but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is 34 years old and lives with her partner and their two children.

She belongs to the "Anna Jarvis III" communal bank which is part of the Arariwa Association. She works for a public entity in the maintenance sector. She has worked for the state for several years and it is going very well. 

On this occasion, she requires the loan to buy wines and panettones to sell during the Christmas season. 

She thanks all those who, through this loan, are becoming part of her dream and promises to meet repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wines and panettones.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en esta misma ciudad, ella tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de llamadas a celulares móviles de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que hace este servicio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar la línea de los celulares. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member was born in the town of Cusco and that's where she lives. She's 38 years old. She's in a common law marriage and from this relationship she has two children. She's a member of the "Anna Jarvis II" communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.
Her main business is providing cell phone call services on a traveling basis. She has been in this line of work for several years already and it is going very well. On this occasion she requests the loan in order to pay for cell phone lines. She thanks those who become a part of dream through this loan, and she pledges to make her repayments within the scheduled timeframe.

loans.use: to pay for cell phone lines.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 24 años de edad es separado y tiene dos hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar de forma independiente en la construcción de obras, él es albañil de profesión y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa desea pintar entonces va comprar pintura. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the city of Cuzco and lives in the same city where he was born. He is 24 years old and is separated with two children. He belongs to the “Anna Jarvis III” Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa.

His principal economic activity is working independently in construction. He is a bricklayer by profession and he is doing well. At this time he needs a loan to do maintenance on his house. He wants to paint it and purchase paint. He is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this medium and is committed to making his payments within the established time period.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his house. He wants to paint it and buy paint.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 27-year-old man and the father of two children whom he loves very much. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has been operating an electrical workshop for 14 years. He has employed two workers who assist him in his business and offer services to customers.  He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER to buy electrical spare parts for his business in order to fix the different cars of his clients. He hopes his family can confide in him and help him to improve as a person. He dreams of investing in a much larger business in order to improve his living conditions and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy electrical spare parts for his business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El socio continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con el trabajo de la construcción civil. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa o sea va arreglar el techo pues se están acercando la época de las precipitaciones fluviales. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues with the “Anna Jarvis III” Commual Bank and with his work in civil construction. He is a responsible and friendly person who is helping his family get ahead. He is requesting a loan to do maintenance on his house; he is going to repair the roof since the rainy season is approaching. He is happy with the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his house.

loans.name: Sandra Elena

texts.es: Doña Sandra Elena de 43 años de edad siempre trabaja para un colegio público como conserje, ella sola con su salario ha venido pagando todos sus créditos obtenidos con Afodenic, es una clienta que está optando por su décimo crédito para infraestructura en su vivienda, en esta ocasión cambiara el techo y las vigas de su casa los cuales están muy viejos y deteriorados para eso necesita comprar perlines, laminas de zinc y pagar la mano de obra, quedándole pendientes varias mejoras por hacerle a su casa, pero así al suave irá mejorando sus condiciones de vida para ella y sus pequeños hijos quienes continúan estudiando y el mayor deseo de ella es que sean grandes profesionales para que se puedan valer por ellos mismos.
texts.en:
Doña Sandra Elena is 43 years old and has been working for a public school as a janitor. She, alone, has been paying off all of the loans obtained from Afodenic on her salary. She is a client who has chosen to take out her tenth loan in order to upgrade the infrastructure of her dwelling. At this time, she will replace the roof and beams of her house, which are very old and deteriorated. Thus she needs to purchase purlins, zinc sheets and pay a work crew.

She still has several other improvements to make on her house and will do them gradually thereby improving the living conditions of herself and her young children who continue with their studies. Her greatest desire is that they become professionals so they can fend for themselves.

loans.use: to buy purlins and zinc sheets and pay a work crew to replace the roof of her house.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de ceviche. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues cumplió su sueño de abrir un restaurante donde expende sus platos de comida y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar una congeladora pues desea implementar más su restaurante. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pamela continues in the communal bank “Anna Jarvis III” with the sale of ceviche (marinated seafood cocktail). She is a responsible and friendly person that gets ahead, since she’s already achieved her dream of opening a restaurant where she sells her dishes. It's going very well. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy a freezer, which she wishes to use more in her restaurant. Pamela is happy about the loan, and she promises to make the payments of her share.

loans.use: buy a freezer.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El socio nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él tiene 20 años de edad y no tiene hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar de forma independiente en la construcción de obras, él es albañil de profesión y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para estudiar la carrera técnica de construcción de edificaciones entonces desea pagar su matrícula. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the city of Cusco, where he has lived all his life.  He is 20 years old, childless, and is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Anna Jarvis III" communal bank.  

His main business activity is working as a self-employed builder in the construction industry, and it is going well for him.  He is now seeking a loan so that he can study for a technical qualification in building.  

The loan will be used to pay his tuition fees.  He is grateful to those who are helping him to achieve his dream in this way and he is committed to making his repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Callao pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de caramelos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar golosinas como dulces, chicles, chocolates, galletas y otras cosas más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Jenifer] was born in Cusco and continues to live in the beautiful city.  She’s 26 years old, in a common law marriage and has two children.  She is a member of “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

She sells candy, has been doing this for several years, and things are going well for her.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy snacks such as candy, gum, chocolates, cookies and other things.  She is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 39 años de edad es conviviente y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de jugos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar artefactos como licuadora, extractor y otros más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Margarita] was born in Cusco and continues to live there.  She’s 39 years old, in a common law marriage and has two children.  She is a member of “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.

She sells juices, has been doing this for several years, and things are going well for her.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy things like a blender, juice extractor, and other things.  She is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a blender and juice extractor.

loans.name: Soledad Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 27 años de edad es madre soltera pero tiene un hijo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de láminas escolares pero ahora se dedica también a la venta de ropa. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estos negocios y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa como chompas, pantalones, camisas, polos, casacas y otras cosas más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Soledad was born in the city of Cusco, and she still lives in the city where she was born. She is 27 years old, and she is a single mother of one child. She belongs to the communal bank “Anna Jarvis III” of the Arariwa Association.

Her main economic activity is selling paper for school, but now she also sells clothes. She’s had these businesses for a few years, and they’re going very well. This time she needs a loan to buy clothes like sweaters, pants, shirts, polo shirts, jackets and other things. Soledad thanks those who are part of this dream by these means, and she promises to make the payments of her dues on time.

loans.use: buy clothes like sweaters, pants, shirts, polo shirts, jackets and other things.

loans.name: Fabián De Jesús

texts.es:
El deseo de salir adelante es un suceso que nace del corazón y no existen impedimentos que obstaculicen la realización de los sueños. Este es el caso de Fabián un joven de 30 años que a pesar de encontrarse en situación de discapacidad,  sordomudo de nacimiento, se lo ha jugado todo por montar su propio taller de fabricación de herraduras, con el fin de suplir las necesidades de su localidad. Hoy recurre a un préstamo por que está decidido a dar pasos en grande y convertirse en un microempresario, y para lograrlo necesita comprar la materia prima  para dar inicio a su mayor sueño. Tener negocio propio.

Fabián inició montando su taller en la parte trasera de su casa, debido  su condición económica actual, pero sueña con tener en el corto plazo un local que le permita el acceso a un mayor número de clientes generando mayores ingresos que le permitan obtener una mejor calidad de vida para el y su familia.
texts.en:
The desire to get ahead in life is something that is born in the heart and there are not impediments that exist to obstruct the realization of dreams. This is the case of Fabian, a young 30-year-old man, who in spite of being disabled, deaf and mute since birth, he has risked everything to create his own workshop to manufacture horseshoes in order to supply his area with these necessities. Now he is resorting to a loan because he is determined to take big strides and transform himself into a micro-entrepreneur. To achieve this, he needs to buy raw materials to begin his biggest dream: to have his own business.

Fabian began to set up his workshop in back of his house due to his current economic situation, but he dreams of soon having a location that will allow him to have access to a greater number of clients generating more income which will let him obtain a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy raw material for the manufacture of horseshoes.

loans.name: Gladis Carlota

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Gladis, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y la menor de  13 años que  estudia en el colegio, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se  dedica al comercio. 

Doña Gladis realiza el crédito para ayudar a su marido el mismo que se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, él tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad al cual se desplaza dia a dia para vender sus productos, ella en ocasiones acompañaba a su esposo para ayudarle en su labor, pero que en la actualidad no puede porque tiene un problema en sus ojos, ella ha perdido casi la totalidad de la visión por la cual ya no puede ayudar a su esposo, este negocio lo tiene por más de veinte años y con el cual él ha sacado adelante a su familia  honradamente.

Este crédito es para invertirlo en frutas y legumbres y así poder seguir vendiendo sus productos, lleva 15 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es poder recuperar su vista ya está en tratamientos para poder operarse.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its commercial district, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people. 

Gladis lives in this place. She is 45 years old and is married and from that relationship she has four children, three adults and the youngest is 13 years old and is studying in high school. Three of the children still live in her home. Her husband makes a living in business. 

Gladis would like credit to help her husband who makes a living selling fruits and vegetables. He has a market stall in the city in which he goes to day after day to sell his products. She sometimes accompanies her husband to help him in his work, but she currently cannot because she has a problem with her eyes. She has lost almost all of her vision which is why she cannot help her husband. The business is over 20 years old and with it he has honorably helped his family get ahead in life. 

This credit is to invest in fruits and vegetables and that way to be able to continue selling their products. She has been with the Communal Bank for 15 years and she likes it because of the help that they have always offered with credits.
 
Her dream is to be able to recover her vision. She is already in treatments to be able to have an operation.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí vive la señora Rosa, tiene  40 años  de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 2 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Ella es Lic. En Ciencias de La Educación.

Doña Rosa es maestra de un centro educativo en la ciudad de Portoviejo, pero además de esto en su casa tienen un negocio familiar con sus padres, preparan y venden dulces de todos los sabores, colores y formas, ella trabaja todos los días ya que en las mañanas va a la escuela pero en las tardes y fines de semana se dedica a elaborar los dulces, aunque sus padres trabajan todo el día. Muchos comerciantes llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus productos ya que son deliciosos y por eso venden muy bien. Lleva siete años dedicada a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar azúcar, frutas, huevos, harina y otros víveres necesarios para la elaboración de sus dulces. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por más de tres años  y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es tener algún dia un carro para facilitarle el transporte a su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank María José meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its commercial district, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people. 

Rosa lives here. She is 40 years old and she is a single mother of a 2-year-old daughter. She lives in her parents' home. She has a degree in Education. 

Rosa is a teacher at an educational center in the city of Portoviejo, but as well as this, at her house she has a family business with her parents. They prepare and sell candies in all different flavors, colors and shapes. She works every day so that in the mornings she goes to the school but in the afternoons and on the weekends she makes a living making the candies, even though her parents work all day. Many shopkeepers come to her house to buy her products because they are delicious and that is why they sell very well. She has been making a living in this activity for seven years and it has gone very well for her because she has many customers. 

She will use this credit to buy sugar, fruit, eggs, flour and other necessary supplies for making her candies. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than three years and she likes it because the credits help her a lot. 

Her dream is to one day have a car to help her get to work.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit, eggs, flour and other supplies.

loans.name: Laura Monserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Laura, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9 y 2 años y un bebé de 5 meses, el mayor  estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica al negocio familiar. 

La señora Laura con su esposo tienen en las afueras de su casa un pequeño restaurante en el cual preparan y venden el delicioso ceviche de pescado y de otros mariscos, trabajan todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las  a las 18h00 menos el día miércoles que es su día de descanso. Llevan dos años con su negocio y les ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes los prefieren porque su ceviche es delicioso y sus clientes quedan contentos con la atención que se les da a cada uno de ellos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pescado, chifles, sodas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace dos años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The María José Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its commercial district, for its traditional celebrations of Saint Peter and Saint Paul and for the happiness of its people. 

Laura lives in this place. She is 30 years old and she has a common law marriage from which she has three children, ages 9 and 2, and a 5-month-old baby. The eldest studies at school. Her spouse makes a living in his family business.

Laura and her spouse have a small restaurant outside their house in which they prepare and sell delicious ceviche made from fish and other seafood. They work every day from 6:00 to 6:00 except for Wednesday, which is their day off. They have had their business for two years and it has gone very well for them because their customers prefer them because their ceviche is delicious and their customers are happy with the customer service they give to each one of them. 

She will use this credit to buy fish, plaintain chips, sodas and other supplies to prepare the food. She has been with the Communal Bank for two years and she likes it because she started her business with the first credit. 
 
Her goals are to get ahead in her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fish, plantain chips, sodas and other supplies.

loans.name: Martha Yesenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
