En este lugar v vive la señora Martha, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad, la mayor  estudian en colegio y el menor en la escuela. Su esposo se  dedica a la agricultura.

La señora Martha al ver que su esposo no gana mucho en la agricultura recogió todos sus ahorros que tenia y con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que recibió del banco comunal puso un negocio de venta de útiles escolares y papelería en su casa, a su negocio le va muy bien ya que su casa queda muy cerca de un colegio y con esto sus ventas están aseguradas, en la actualidad también está vendiendo helados con lo cual se gana algo extra, tiene cinco años con este negocio el cual les ayuda mucho cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cuadernos, esferográficos, lápices y otros útiles escolares. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir mejorando su papelería.
texts.en:
The communal bank “María José” meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a business zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and Pan Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Martha lives here. She is 34 years old, married and from this relationship has two children of 16 and 7 years of age. The oldest is in secondary school and the youngest is in primary school. Her husband works in agriculture.

Seeing that her husband does not earn enough in agriculture, she gathered together their savings that they had and with the support of one of the loans she received from the communal bank started a business selling school supplies and stationery in her home. Her business is going very well because her home is close to a school and her sales are assured. She also sells ice cream in order to earn something extra. She has been in business for five years which helps a lot when her husband does not have work.

This loan will be used to buy notebooks, pens, pencils, and other school supplies. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because with one of the loans she started her business.

Her goal is to continuing improving her stationery shop.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, pencils, and other school supplies for her home-based stationery shop.

loans.name: Verónica Janeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María José se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, el mayor  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es policía.

La señora Verónica tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras, frutas, además de ciertos artículos de bazar y papelería, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, tiene tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien ya que su secreto es tener de todo y así ha ganado mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 1 año, es la tesorera y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank “María José” meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a business zone, for its traditional festivals of San Pedro and Pan Pablo, and for the happiness of its people.

Verónica lives here. She is 32 years old, married with two children of 8 and 3 years of age, with the oldest attending school. Her husband is a policeman.

Verónica has a store in her home. There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, legumes, vegetables, fruits, and also some bazaar and stationery items. She works every day from 6:00AM until 8:00PM, and sometimes later. She has had her business for three years and it is going very well since her secret is to have everything, and thus she has gained many clients.

This loan is going to be used to stock her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other staples. She has been with the communal bank for one year. She is the treasurer and she likes it because the members are very responsible.

Her goals are to continue getting ahead in her business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other staples for her home-based store

loans.name: Jenny Mariuxi

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 13 y 8 años de edad,  los tres mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido es albañil.

La señora Jenny tiene una tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, helados, bebidas energizantes entre otras cosas, en la actualidad está vendiendo también productos de bazar y papelería con lo cual está ganando algo extra, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados. Tiene 5 años con su negocio el mismo que lo está mejorando con cada crédito que recibe.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos der primera necesidad, artículos de bazar y papelería. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho en tiempos difíciles.
 
Su sueño es que no les falte nada a sus hijos.
texts.en: In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi , which has been known for years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos, the members of the Damas Al Poder communal bank meet every two weeks.  Jenny lives here; she is 34 years old and lives in a common-law relationship from which she has four children aged 16, 14, 13 and 8.  The three eldest are in secondary school and the youngest in primary school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.  Jenny has a store in her house where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, ice cream and energy drinks, among other things.  She also sells variety store goods and stationery, with which she is earning extra income.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and sometimes later.  Her children help her with her work when they are not busy.  She has had this business for 5 years, and it improves with every loan that she receives.   She will use this loan to supply her store better.  She will buy essential products, variety store goods and stationery.  She has been in the communal bank for 3 cycles, and she likes it because the loans have helped her a lot in difficult times.  Her dream is that her children will lack for nothing.

loans.use: to buy essential products, variety store goods and stationery.

loans.name: Nuvia Aidee

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Damas Al Poder.

Aquí vive la señora Nuvia, tiene 41 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  4 hijos de 20, 15, 14 y 11 años de edad, el mayor este año empezó la universidad y  los tres menores estudian en la escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Hace varios años ella realizo un curso en el cual aprendió belleza y arreglo personal.

Doña Nuvia es una muy buena madre que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), zapatos, carteras y varias cosas más, ella también realiza trabajos de pintado de uñas, tinturados y cortes de cabello ya sea en su casa o a domicilio, al momento que realiza estos trabajos también ofrece sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, es así como ella sola ha sacado adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, carteras,  perfumes, cremas y otros productos que vende. Lleva 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les da la institución.
 
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees, the communal bank “Damas Al Poder” meets twice a month.

Nuvia lives here. She is 41 years old, a single mother of 4 children, ages 20, 15, 14, and 11 years old. The oldest has begun university and the three youngest attend school. All of the children still live with her. Some years ago she took a course in which she learned beauty and grooming. 

Nuvia is a very good mother who in order to have her own resources and continue raising her children works selling clothing through the Yanbal catalog (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women), shoes, wallets and various other items. She also does nails, dyes and cuts hair at their home or her home. While doing her work she offers her products and leaves them on credit and collects each week. She has been doing this for more than 9 years and is doing very well, and this is how she has raised her children on her own.

This loan is to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, perfume, creams and other products to sell. She has been with the communal bank for six years and she likes it because of the benefits the institution offers.

Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, wallets, perfume, creams and other products for her beauty and grooming business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar para una entidad pública en el área de mantenimiento pero también tiene un pequeño restaurante donde expende ricos platos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, aceite, fideos y otras cosas más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
Justina was born in the city of Cusco and she lives in the same city where she was born. She is 38 years old and has a common-law marriage, from which she has two children. She belongs to the communal bank "Anna Jarvis III" of Asociación Arariwa. 

Her main job is working in the maintenance sector of a public entity, but she also has a small restaurant where she sells delicious dishes. She has worked in this business for several years and it is going well for her. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and other things. She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through these means and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and others.

loans.name: Yoni Maribel

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y servicio de corte de cabello. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como tijeras y otras cosas. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yoni is still a member of the communal bank “Anna Jarvis III” and is a hair stylist. She is responsible and kind and supports her family. She is applying for a loan to buy scissors and other items for her work. She is happy to have financial support and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy scissors and other items for her work.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relacion tiene dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida entonces tiene una pequeño restaurante. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Su esposo es albañil y se dedica a construir casas, edificios y otras cosas más. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar herramienta de trabajo para su esposo. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elsa was born in the city of Puno, but she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is 28 and married with two children. She belongs to the communal bank  "Anna Jarvis III" of Asociación Arariwa. 

Her main job is selling food, so she has a small restaurant. She has been working in this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Her husband is a builder and he builds homes, buildings, and other structures. On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy tools for her husband. She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through these means and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Yajaida

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en esta misma ciudad, ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual dos hijos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de carne en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member was born and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 36 years old and is in a common-law relationship of which she has two children. She belongs to the communal bank “Anna Jarvis III” Arariwa Association.

Her main economic activity is the sale of meat in one of the most popular markets in Cusco. She has been working in this business for several years and is doing well. 

She needs this loan to buy meat. She thanks those who are part of this dream and she agrees to comply with the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, él pertenece al banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es trabajar de forma independiente en la construcción de obras, él es albañil de profesión y le va muy bien. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería o sea va comprar verduras como cebollas, perejil, choclo, papa y otras cosas más. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
[Juan] was born in Puno but lives in Cusco.  He’s 39 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has seven children.  He is a member of the “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa.
 
He works independently in construction; he’s a mason and things are going well for him.  His wife sells vegetables in one of the most popular markets in the city.  On this occasion he needs a loan in order to buy merchandise such as onions, parsley, corn, potatoes, and other things.  He is grateful to those who form part of this dream and promised to repay on time.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de verduras. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas, papa, zanahorias, alverjas y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Andrea continues with the communal bank "Anna Jarvis III" and with the sale of produce. She is a responsible and kind person who is getting her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables like onions, potatoes, carrots, peas and other things. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pumpkins, onions, potatoes, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de chicha de jora pero también se dedica a la venta de comida. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como sacos de arroz, verduras y carnes. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Faustina continues with the communal bank "Anna Jarvis III" and the sale of chicha de jora (traditional corn liquor) and food. She is a responsible and kind person who is getting her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies like sacks of rice, vegetables and meat. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of rice, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de productos de belleza. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como perfumes y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Yovana continues to sell beauty products and to participate in the "Anna Jarvis III" communal bank. She is a responsible and kind person who works to get her family ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy perfumes and other beauty products. She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and other beauty products

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de ropa. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante. Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa para niños y adultos pues se están acercando la campaña navideña. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nilda continues with the communal bank "Anna Jarvis III" and the sale of clothing. She is a responsible and kind person who is moving ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for children and adults for the approaching Christmas season. She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Marites Eugenia

texts.en: Marites Eugenia is a hog raiser in the village where she lives. She is now thirty-six years old, married to Warlito, and they have three children. Marites Eugenia would like to ensure the good growth and nutrition of her hogs. With this in mind, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. This will help her hogs grow healthier and when they achieve the desired weight, she can sell them at a higher price. This will lead to additional income. Marites Eugenia would like to keep expanding her business as a successful hog raiser for the overall welfare of her family. From this, she will be able to save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is from La Suerte. He is married and has four children. To meet his family's needs, Leonardo raises hogs to fatten, breed, and sell. He has been doing this for over seven years and earns about 4,000 PHP for each hog. He has spent his income wisely on food and school fees. Leonardo would like to develop his business, but he does not have enough money to do so. So he is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan from ASKI to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines to ensure his hogs health. If the hogs grow well, he can sell them at a higher price and will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine, and vaccines to ensure his hogs health

loans.name: Adoris

texts.en: Adoris is 43 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, Adoris and her spouse work hard to acquire income. Adoris raises hogs to sell while her husband works as a farmer in their village. They live in their house in La Suerte. Adoris hopes to make her hog-raising business become more profitable so she is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy medicines and hog feed. This way, she will ensure good nutrition for her hogs and will be able to ask for a higher price for them when she sells them. With good profits from their businesses, the couple will give their children the best possible education and will some day be able to ensure a prosperous life for the family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and hog feed

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yi's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Moung Russey District in Battambang Province, Cambodia, Yi is 50 years old and married. She has six children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband have struggled to feed their children by growing rice on five hectare of farmland. Having engaged in this business for thirty-five years, they are able to earn approximately 16,000 KHR per day, and they manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Lacking capital to support the business is their main challenge. 

Yi is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group of two to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. Yi hopes to grow her rice healthfully and timely so as to make a living better and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and married with two children. Edgar raises and breeds hogs in La Suerte, the village where he lives. Once he fattens the pigs to the desired weight, he sells them to butchers. He usually gets about 4,000 PHP per hog. Edgar wants to raise more pigs and ensure their health, so he can sell them at a higher price. To do so, he is borrowing 30,000 PHP from ASKI to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs. With increased profits Edgar is confident he can give his children the best education possible. He knows this will mean a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Her business involves raising hogs for future sale.  Each one earns her 3,000 PHP, which is just enough to sustain her family's meal requirements and to pay their monthly bills. Right now, Epifania is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase an additional piglet to raise and pay for its feed and vaccines. Epifania works hard to make her business profitable and hopes to someday achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet to raise and pay for its feed and vaccines

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia, Ith is a 28-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her; one is still in school while the other one is too young for school. To support the family, Ith has been working as a tailor while her husband earns an income by farming rice and also working as a motor-taxi driver in the local area. Having been involved in this business for almost three years, she can earn about US $9 per day and manages to save about US $2 each day after offsetting daily expenses.

This is the second microloan for Ith with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully paid back the past loan which has helped her to relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting a loan of US $300 to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice fruitfully, so as to improve her family's living condition and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Kong is a 46-year-old widowed mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Farming rice and growing beans are the main source of the family’s income and Kong has been struggling to feed her children for twenty years. To supplement the income, she also catches fish in the local area. Her daily income is approximately 40,000 KHR and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. Low crop yield resulting from floods is her main challenge. 

Kong has been with VisionFund for five cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family’s living condition. Now she is leading her group of five to seek a loan. As the leader, Kong will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her bean planting. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her current business in order to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her bean planting

loans.name: Belma

texts.en: Belma is 52 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Being a responsible mother, she supported her husband in generating income to satisfy their family needs and finance the education of their children. They aimed to improve their standard of living and educate their children so that they will be employed someday. Due to financial difficulty, they work together to make hollow blocks that they sell in their community. They plan to produce more hollow blocks to sell, but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, Belma is asking for an additional 35,000 PHP to buy cement and sand needed in making hollow blocks. She believes that this loan will help them to improve the business and become more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand needed in making hollow blocks

loans.name: Sarat's Group

texts.en:
Sarat is 38 years old and married. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has five children, all of whom are dependents and help their family earn additional income. She has earned a living through selling vegetables and working for others for a fee for several years. Her husband also supplements the income by working as a motor-taxi driver. 

Sarat’s group has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the past loans. Sarat has wisely used previous funds to expand her current business as well as to support her living conditions. Now she is leading her group of two to request another loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more various kinds of vegetables to resell. She hopes to earn a large income for the family so as to make their living better.

loans.use: To buy more various kinds of vegetables to resell

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
40-year-old Chreb is a villager in a rural village of the Srey Snom district located in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom (two daughters and one son) are her responsibility and currently in school.

To support her family, Chreb has been working hard as a rice farmer on a five-hectare plot of farmland for 10 years, earning around 10,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and managing to save approximately 5,000 KHR after factoring in the daily expenses.

Chreb is leading a loan group of three female members, all of whom are first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva partner), to take out a loan in the amount of 2,500,000 KHR in total.

With this first-time requested loan portion, which is 1,000,000 KHR, the group representative (Chreb) will  purchase fertilizer and rice-seed, and cover the cost of labor. After receiving her loan portion and using it in a smart manner, this hard-working woman, Chreb, hopes that her rice-growing business will provide a good quality crop so that she can sell it for greater profit and use the anticipated profit to improve the living standard of her family and keep her beloved children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Set, 59, lives in a rural area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has six children. To make a living, she has been selling fried potatoes for 12 years. The current business earns her about 70,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Set’s group consists of two members who have been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. Set completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to relieve family burdens. Now she is leading her group to request another loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy spices for making fried potatoes. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy spices for making fried potatoes

loans.name: Serm

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area of the Sangke District in Battambang Province, Cambodia, Serm is 48 years old and widowed. She has six children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has struggled to feed her children by growing rice, coconuts, and mangoes in her local area. She has been engaged in this business for twenty years.

Serm is a first time borrower with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of US $800. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes her crop yield will be profitable and productive so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 30 years old and a mother of two. Due to a lack of job opportunities, she runs a small variety store in their community to generate income. She aims to improve the business and generate sufficient income to provide for her family's needs and support the schooling of her children. Despite financial difficulty, she has the determination to improve their standard of living to ensure the future of her children. She planned to improve her small variety store to increase her income, but due to financial difficulty, she is asking for an additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy more stock of soft drinks, candies, biscuits, junk foods, beverages and frozen foods for sale. She mentioned this financial assistance will enable her to make an improvement in the business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soft drinks, candies, biscuits, junk foods, beverages and frozen foods for sale

location.town: Brgy. Almaguer North, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sorm's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old mother of two dependent children, Sorm has made a living through raising chickens for five years, while her husband complements their income by working for others for a fee. Her family’s daily income is about 28,000 KHR; of this she is able to set aside about 10,000 KHR a day after expenses. 

Sorm’s group consists of two members who live in the same village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. She has been with VisionFund for six cycles and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy feed for nourishing her chickens. She hopes to fatten her chickens so as to sell them for a good price, and with this to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy feed for nourishing chickens

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district of Cambodia, Hean is 47 years old and married. He has one son. The main sources of family income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee, which he and his wife has been engaged in for eight years. He can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses. 

Hean has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for nine cycles. He fully paid back his previous loans, which have helped his family in meeting their needs. Now he is leading his group of two to request another loan. As the leader, Hean will use his some of his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland, and devote part of it to labor fees. He hopes his farm will become more productive and profitable so he can sell his crops for a high price in order to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Chy's Group

texts.en:
Chy, 29, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has one son who is still in school. For the last seven years, Chy and her husband have been farming rice as their main source of income. Sometimes, she sells rice soup in the local area to earn additional income for the family. Together, they can earn about 60,000 KHR per day through their current business and manage to save about 15,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Chy’s group consists of two members; this is Chy’s third loan cycle with VisionFund. The past loans, which she successfully repaid, have helped her support the family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to request a new loan. Chy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and to spend on labor costs. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice-paddy so as to make a better living and keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Savorn is 32 years old and married. She has three children to take care of and they are still in school. To feed her family, she has been growing corn and cassava for two years. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to better feed their children. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to help meet the family’s needs.

Savorn’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Savorn is a first-time borrower with VisionFund, and is leading her group to apply for a loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her plantation. She hopes to raise healthy crops to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Sarean's Group

texts.en:
Sarean is 26 years old and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Moungkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is married with two children who are still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for twenty years. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sarean’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Sarean has just joined VisionFund this loan cycle, and is leading her group to request a loan of 600,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice more healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sokhat's Group

texts.en:
Sokhat is 26 years old. She is married with two dependent children who are too young for school, and lives in a rural area of the Dambae district in Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she has been farming rice on one hectare of farmland for several years, and supplements her family’s income by selling grocery items. From her current business, she can earn about 19,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sokhat has been with VisionFund for four cycles, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Sokhat completely paid back her previous loans, which she wisely used to better support her family. Now she and her fellow group member are applying for a new loan. As the group leader, she wants to use her portion of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and to buy more grocery items for resale. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice in a healthy and timely way so as to make a better living, and also to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Sinoem's Group

texts.en:
Sinoem is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three sons in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Cambodia. She and her husband have been engaged in a tailoring business for several years. The current business earns her family about 27,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 7,000 KHR each day. 

This is the fourth loan for Sinoem with Kiva partner VisionFund, while the other group members have just joined VisionFund this cycle. Now Sinoem is leading her group to seek a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more fabric for her tailoring business. She hopes to earn more income from the current business to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more fabric for her tailoring business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Piseth's Group

texts.en:
Piseth is 29 years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living by fishing, while her husband works as a paid construction worker in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 22,000 KHR per day and are able to save about 12,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Piseth’s group consists of three members living in the same area. This is Piseth’s first loan with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for her fishing business. She hopes to catch more fish so as to sell them for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fishing business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen was born in 1984. She has two children who are one and five years old. Her husband is a phone repairman. His income is about 3,000,000 VND. Yen sells phones and electrical machines to earn a living. She makes 3,500,000 VND a month. Yen has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy phones and rice cookers to sell in her store. She wants to use her profits to enlarge her phone store and raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy phones and rice cookers to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan was born in 1960. She has four children who are married. Her husband is a car driver in the agricultural industry. Lan is a carpenter, as are her children. She earns 2,500,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 3,000,000 VND per month. Lan has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy wood and a wood planer for her carpentry business. Her dream is to enlarge her carpentry workshop.

loans.use: to buy wood and a wood planer

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh was born in 1967. She has two children who are students in the 10th and 12th grade. She and her husband sell beverages and beer to earn a living. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND per month. Anh has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,736,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,736,000 VND to buy beer, soft drinks and tea to sell. She wants to use the profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks and tea to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is from the village of San Francisco.  She is 55 years old and a widow.  She raises hogs and works in the Philippines.  She has been engaged in her hog-raising business for many years.  According to her, being a single parent is very difficult.  But, Juliana brings her best to meet the needs of her two children.  At this moment, Juliana is requesting a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP in order to buy feed and vaccine to ensure the proper growth of her hogs.  She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine to ensure the proper growth of her hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mclaren Group

texts.en:
Yasinta is in her late 30’s.  She is married and has three children who still attend school.  She has operated a business, making and selling shoes since 1992.  She works from 7:00 AM to 9:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 32nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy necessary materials, pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She has successfully repaid all of her loans.  She now hopes to obtain a loan to buy more materials for making shoes to sell.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Yasinta will share this loan with her loan group, which is called Mclaren.  The Mclaren Group has 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living working as a delivery man and she has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in her local community.

Tuyet has been in business for 12 years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and materials such as shampoo, dyes and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics and materials such as shampoo, dyes and nail polish.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is 53 years old.  He is married and has three grown children.  At his age, Rodolfo is proud to share that he can still do some field activities like planting, plowing and spraying.  Rodolfo’s wife is a housekeeper and sometimes is also his partner in managing their rice farming business.  The couple is changing their ideas to apply in farming to ensure that they have good production.

Rodolfo has been farming for 29 years.  He wants to continue operating his farming business while he can manage it.  Therefore, Rodolfo is requesting a loan of 42,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he needs for farming.  He looks forward to the success of his efforts in farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he needs to farm.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 36 years old and is married with three children. His priority is to send his children to school so that they can obtain a college education. He experienced a difficult life and wants to give his children a better one. William manages a rice farming business in their village. He has been running this business for 11 years. William has confessed that he doesn't have enough capital to finance his farm. He will use the loan of 27,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and herbicides for plant care. He believes that with the help of the loan he will get a higher yield, increase his income and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Ms. Rasheeda is a 34-year-old married woman.  She has operated a business of selling goats and buffaloes for many years.  She started her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  With the help of her husband, she is running a successful business to help them lead a decent life.  She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices, brings them up and sells them at higher prices.  Her husband also assists her in selling the animals in the local market.  She is supporting her family of four through all her hard work.  

She contacted the Kashf Foundation in order to improve her business and to increase her earnings.  Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PKR for the purchase of two more goats.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her children a good and high quality education through her efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two goats.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a strong and healthy 31-year-old married woman with three children. She has had a hand embroidery business for the past five years. She decided to start her business in order to meet the needs of her family members. Her husband is employed as a sales person and his income is not sufficient to cover the family's everyday expenditures. Parveen is contributing to the family income and is respected a lot in her home for all her hard work. She is confident that she can give her family a decent life.

Parveen wants to grow her business. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and glitter in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. Her dream is to expand her business to the local market which will ultimately help in making her family's standard of living better.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and glitter in large quantities.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 31-year-old married woman. She is efficiently doing a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She started her business from a very small level, but with her dedication and passion of supporting her family members she has gradually improved her business. 

Now she has got three cows to milk. In order to cater more customers, she needs to purchase one more cow.  She has requested a loan of Rs.25,000 that will help her to increase her sales. 

She wishes to use part of her profits in providing good and quality education to her children. Her husband is very happy with the contribution of Najma to family income.

loans.use: To purchase another cow.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn believes that "having patience and strong determination will help you to achieve your goals."  She is 40 years old and chose to be a single. She aims to become successful and financially stable so that she can support financially her old parents and her niece and nephews to finish their studies. 

She was chosen to be the one who will manage the school canteen. She is so happy that she has the opportunity to manage a business. She aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy the needs of her customers. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to buy soft drinks, junk food, candies, biscuits, seasonings, and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in the school canteen. 

She is hoping that she will be successful in her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, junk food, candies, biscuits, seasonings, and raw ingredients to be sold in the school canteen

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Taung Khum district, Pheap is a 46-year-old mother of seven children. 

She and her husband have been farming rice and planting corn on three hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 28 years together, they can earn about 20,000 KHR per day from the current business and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day.

Pheap has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back her past loans. She has smartly used the previous loans to support her family with enough food. 

Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice timely and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working mother who owns and manages a small beauty salon inside a public market. She is 61 years old and has three grown children. She aims to earn and save more money to satisfy their necessities, save for their future, and support the schooling of her grandchildren. 

In this regard, she planned to continue and improve her business to generate a higher income. Because of inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan  of PHP 35,000 to buy scissors and cosmetics needed in her beauty salon. Through this loan, she believes that she can provide a better service to all her customers. 

She is hoping that someday, she will make the business grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy scissors and cosmetics needed in her beauty salon

location.town: Brgy. Lamo, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Hen, 36, lives in a rural area in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung district and has four children, two of whom are living with the family and some of whom are still in school. Hen and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 14 years to make a living. To add to their income, her husband also works as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns Hen about 8,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day; she manages to save about 2,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Hen’s Group consists of four members who live in the same village. Hen has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back her past loans, which have helped her to relieve the burden on her family and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to seek a new loan. As the leader, Hen will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and also hopes to produce more rice to improve her family’s standard living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. Due to hardships in life, she runs a small variety store in their community to supplement her husband's income. She is aiming to have a successful business in order to improve their status of living and give their children a better life. In this regard, she plans to increase her product offerings in order to satisfy her customers' demands. To improve the business, she is requesting PHP 45,000 to buy rice, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies, junk food, beverages and seasonings to sell. Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies, junk food, beverages and seasonings to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jeeran

texts.en: Ms Jeeran is a 55-year-old married woman. She is an active lady and has had a business selling milk for many years. She has four buffaloes for milk. She sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter, cheese and ghee that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide a decent life for her. According to Jeeran, taking a loan from Kashf helps her to grow her business and helps her family members as well. Now she has attained many customers and requested a new loan of RS 25,000 to purchase one more buffalo. This would increase the production capacity of milk and improve her earnings. She said that Kashf Foundation has brought a change in her family life, which increased her respect in the eyes of her husband and her whole family.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Tren's Group

texts.en:
Tren is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and one son in a rural village in the Tbaung Khum district. His son is still in school. Rice farming is the main source of his family’s income and he has been doing this for about 10 years. Sometimes his wife works for others for a fee to earn additional income. The current business earns his family a daily income of about 10,000 KHR, but he is able to save 2,000 KHR each day after deducting daily expenses.

This is the first loan for Tren’s group of two members. He is now leading his group to apply for a loan. As the leader, he will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to grow healthy rice to improve his standard of living and keep his son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Ms. Hanifan is a 53-year-old woman and the mother of four children. For 20 years, Hanifan has been running a business selling milk. She started her business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as did her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She is in her fifth loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his mid-20s, is single, with a baby boy.  He has been earning a living for four years by running a tailoring business making different kinds of clothes. He works from 8 a.m. 9 p.m. daily, and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

He has requested a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania that he wants to use to buy more materials to make more clothes (dresses,trousers, etc.) to resell.  His dream is to one day be able to own an electronics shop.

He will share this loan with his loan group "FLAMINGO," which totals 11 members who hold one another accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat, who is 39 years old, is married with four dependent children. She resides in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and still in school. 

For the past ten years, she has been farming rice while her husband makes palm juice and also buys and sells cows in a local area to support the family. The current business earns her about US$7 per day, and she can manage to save about US$3 each day after paying daily expenses.

This is Sinat’s first loan with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan of US$1,010. With this loan, she is going to buy more cows to resell. 

She hopes this loan will enable her earn more income from the current business so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms Uzma is a 26-year-old married woman. She initiated her business of hand-embroidery with the support of the Kashf foundation. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. 

But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but his income is not sufficient to bear the daily expenditures of family members alone. Uzma’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

In order to cater the demands of her customers without delay, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy raw materials, such as spools of threads and packs of sequins and glittering material in different colors. She is hopinmg to get an increase in her net income, which she will use on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, such as spools of threads and packs of sequins and glittering material in different colors.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two daughters. She lives in a village in the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, where she earns a living by farming rice and planting vegetables while her husband works for others for a fee to help support their family. Together, they can earn about KHR 12,000 per day from their jobs and save about KHR 6,000 a day for future needs.

Nhanh has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan. She successfully used the previous loan to better support her current business and improve her livelihood.  

Now she is leading her group of three to request a loan. Nhanh, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice and sell it for a good price, so that she can improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
Due to the hardship of living, Febelyn engages in buying and selling of ukay-ukay (used clothes) in the public market to help her husband in generating income for the  family. She aimed to improve and strengthen the business  to generate sufficient income and continue sending their children to school. 

In this regard, she planned to acquire more stocks of dry goods to sell in the market. But because of inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy the additional stocks of used clothes for sale. 

Despite problems and difficulties in life, she has the strong determination to improve the business. She believes that her patience and hard work will help her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy two cartons of tomato paste, some garlic, and a little dried okra

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in a rural village of the Kror Kor district, Thea is 26 years old and single. He has earned a living through farming rice on one hectare of farmland and raising pigs for 10 years. He manages to earn about 17,000 KHR per day and can save about 7,000 KHR each day for the family's future needs. 

Thea has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other group member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Thea successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped him to have enough household supplies for his family. Now he is leading his group to request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy pig feed for his pig business and pay labor fees. He hopes to fatten his pigs as well as increase his crop yield and earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for his pig business

loans.name: Ziyoboi

texts.ru: Зиёбой занимается откормом скота  около 10 лет. Погасив свой предыдущий кредит он решил получить очередной. Он трудолюбивый человек и хороший семьянин.     Он воспитывает шестерых детей.    У него дома есть несколько голов скота, его жена продает молоко и молочные изделия соседям а также  продает молоко на рынке.  Его дети взрослые и каждого из них необходимо обеспечить одеждой и едой.    Каждую субботу он выводит скот на рынок и перепродает , на полученную прибыль он покупает продукты питания для дома. Его дети ему помогают.   Кредит получает для приобретения скота и  корма для них.  Он сотрудничает с нашей организацией в течении 2 лет и надеется на дальнейшее сотрудничество и поддержку.
texts.en:
Ziyoboi has worked with fattening cattle for around 10 years. After having repaid his previous loan, he decided to take another one. He is a hardworking man and a good farmer. He is raising six children. He has several livestock at his home, and his wife sells milk and dairy products to the neighbors and also at the market. 

Ziyoboi's children are older and he needs to provide each of them with clothing and food. Every Saturday he takes livestock to the market and resells them, and for the income received he purchases food for the home. His children help him. He receives a loan for the purchase of livestock and fodder for them. He has collaborated with our organization for a period of 2 years and hopes for further collaboration and support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fodder for them

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is 37 years old and a vigorous, married woman and mother of four. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She very well knows the techniques of embroidery. Her husband is a bread earner, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Naseem’s embroidery patterns are unique; people prefer her designs for their weddings, engagements and special occasions. She is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 20,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Horn is 57 years old and widowed. She has one dependent child who is still in school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on two hectares of farmland. She also complements her income by raising pigs. Having been in this business for four years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR 12,000, and she can save about KHR 6,000 per day for future needs. 

Horn is taking her first loan from VisionFund, while her husband has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan, and will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Ith's Group

texts.en:
Ith is 53 years old and lives in a rural village of the Kror Kor district. She has seven children, one of whom is a dependent and still in school. Ith has made a living as a rice farmer for thirty years, and her husband makes palm juice in the local area to earn additional income. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day after off-setting daily expenses.

Ith’s group consists of two female members. This is Ith's third loan, and her co-member’s first loan with VisionFund. Her past two loans, which she repaid, have helped her to acquire enough household supplies for her family. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan 1,000,000 KHR each, and will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her land and buffalo for her farming business. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy field so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and buffalo

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Sam, 53, lives in a village in Pursat province’s Bakan district in Cambodia. She is a widowed mother of six children, two of whom are dependents but work for others for a fee to help support their family. To make a living, Sam has been farming rice for almost 33 years. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after paying for her daily expenses. 

Sam’s group consists of three members who live in the same village, and Sam is a first time borrower with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan, and will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cultivated land and to pay labor fees. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely way and sell it for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cultivated land

loans.name: Malengo Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who go to school. For one year now, Christina has earned a living by running a genge (a grocery hut) business, selling fruits and vegetables. She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy the missing genge items, covered household expenses and has paid back all her loan successfully. She requests a loan to increase genge stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Malengo," which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase stock to resell in her genge (grocery hut).

loans.name: Sagneam's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Sagneam, 39, has three children in total. Two of them are staying with the family and still in school. She and her husband are rice farmers who have been farming for 10 years to make a living. Her family’s daily income is about 10,000 KHR per day.

Sagneam has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the loans, which have helped her improve her livelihood from cycle to cycle. Now leading her group to seek a new loan, Sagneam will use her portion of the money to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice in a healthy way and also hopes to make more rice to improve her family’s living standard and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a vigorous, 46-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past three years. She enjoys her business and is very famous in her circle for providing good embroidery designs.

Ms. Parveen is in charge of providing her family with bread and butter, as her husband's income alone is not sufficient to meet the requirements of ten family members. She has improved her business gradually with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Because of her trust in this institution, she has again requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy materials for embellishment such as sequins, pearls, and spools of thread. This will allow her business to flourish, which will ultimately help generate more cash. She dreams of providing her children with good-quality education for a better future.

loans.use: To buy materials for embellishment such as sequins, pearls, and spools of thread.

loans.name: Mrika

texts.en:
Mrika is a 44-year-old, widowed, mother of four school-aged children ranging in age from 8 to 18. They live in rural northwest Albania. She and her family were persecuted under the communist era, which made Mrika’s life up to age 22 very difficult and marked by extreme emotional, psychological and financial struggles. The death of her husband added to her existing pain. He passed away when their youngest child was only two months old. However, Mrika has worked hard and been able to raise her children and send them to school.

Mrika has been able to run a livestock and agricultural business. The main hardship in her business had been that she had no stable and the animals would get sick and die. With the building of a stable, her income from this business has increased and has been going very well. 

Mrika now wants to buy one more milk cow with a calf with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow with a calf

loans.name: Allah Kabo Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIDIATOU est responsable du  groupe ALLAH KABO. Mariée, elle est mère de  Neuf (09) enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgés a 12 ans. 02 de ses enfants vont  à l’école et elle a (03) personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 07ans.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  une caisse de tomate, 01 sac d’aubergine, du poivre et des choux.
Elle  veut épargner ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mrs. KADIDIATOU is the leader of the group ALLAH KABO. She is a married mother of nine children aged 12 to 30, two of whom attend school. She has three dependents in her care. 

Mrs. Kadidiatou has been selling condiments for the past seven years. She buys her stock at the local markets. Her customer base consists of both men and women.

She plans to buy one case of tomatoes, one bag of eggplants, some pepper and some cabbage. She will use her profits to bolster her savings. 

Her goals are to expand her business and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy one case of tomatoes, one bag of eggplants, some pepper and some cabbage.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 38 years old and has three school-age children.  She and her husband aim to improve their status of living, to educate their children, and to give them a bright future.  In this regard, Elizabeth engages in selling AVON, Natasha and MSE products in their community.  She has been in this business for almost two years and usually earns a profit of 6,000 PHP per month.  This is used for their daily expenses and school allowances.  Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities she needs to increase her income.  Elizabeth is asking for the additional capital of 15,000 (PHP) to improve her business.  She intended to use the loan to buy additional stock to sell (AVON, Natasha, MSE).  She is hoping that someday she will make her business viable and a profitable source of income.

loans.use: to buy AVON, Natasha, and MSE products for resale.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
A resident of a rural village of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Mon is 56 years old and married. She has five children to take care of, one of whom is still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for fifteen years. To earn more income, Mon’s husband also raises pigs and works for others for a fee to better feed their children. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Mon has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back her previous loans, which have helped her family to procure enough food. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, which she wants to use to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a proper house for living in.

loans.use: To renovate her old house

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.ru: Гайбулло  молодой повар с большим опытом работы. Он  работает по своей специальности в ресторане и очень любит свою работу.   Гайбулло  женат и у него двое маленьких детей.   Он недавно переехал на новую квартиру и хочет сделать ремонт.    У него зарплата  хорошая, но все равно накопить  деньги на такие расходы  не получается.    Поэтому он решил получить кредит и постепенно расплачиваться с ним.  На полученный кредит Гайбулло планирует купить строительные материалы.  Он надеется,что этот кредит поможет молодой семье и он будет работать с Арванд  долго.
texts.en:
Gaibullo is a young cook with a large work experience. He works as a cook at a restaurant and loves his work very much. 

Gaibullo is married and he has two young children. They moved to a new apartment not long ago and he would like to repair it. His pay is good, but to save up money for such expenses does not work. Therefore he decided to take a loan and gradually pay it off. 

For the loan received Gaibullo plans to purchase building materials. He hopes that this loan helps the young family, and he will work with Arvand for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms. Sharifan is a 56-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. 

Two years ago she began embroidery work in her house for the people living in her community. She started the business of hand embroidery, and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf foundation. 

Ms. Sharifan has been in association with Kashf for six years and shown excellent repayment behavior. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including pearls, sequins and spools of threads in various colors for her embroidery to increase her revenue. 

She desires to spend any earned income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To buy raw material including pearls, sequins and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is fifty years old and lives in a rural village in northeast Albania.  She has seven children ranging in age from 12 to 30 years old; the two youngest are girls, whom she wants to educate because they are good students. Before moving to their current location, they all lived in a very rural area that they say was not prosperous because of the effect of geographical conditions on their living and activities.

For the past eleven years in their new location, they have had better opportunities, and they have been enjoying it so far. Dave has been engaged in livestock, which has proved to be profitable. She wants to repair their stable with the loan of 100,000 Albanian lek (ALL) that she’s requesting from Kiva.

loans.use: To repair an animal stable

loans.name: Shahjahan

texts.en:
Ms. Shahjahan is a 51-year-old married woman. She has had a shoe-making business for the past five years. During one year, she had low capital because of many problems receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. She was afraid of taking an informal loan from relatives, so she contacted the Kashf Foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor and gradually improved her business.

Ms. Shahjahan is an energetic person and eager to support her family by meeting her children's basic necessities, including food, health care, and education. She is also responsible for improving their standard of living. Her children help her with her business. In order to cope with the increasing demand, Ms. Shahjahan requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, and soles in large quantities. This will enable her to handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence to better support her family. She says that micro-finance services enabled her to improve her family's standard of living and send her kids to school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for shoe-making such as leather, plastic leather, and soles in large quantities.

loans.name: Survey Group

texts.en:
Happy, who is in her early 30s, is married and lives with her husband and three school-going children. For seven years now, Happy has been earning a living by running two businesses, a restaurant and a grocery store. She is a hardworking woman. She works from 5 a.m. to 12 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

She has requested her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to increase the inventory of her two businesses so she can sell to more customers. Her dream is to be an international businesswoman one day.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group "Survey," which has 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on two business stocks.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда 53 года ответственная и трудолюбивая женщина,замужем, имеет троих детей. В 1992 году Мавлюда начала свой бизнес,она продавала хозяйственные  товары.   Благодаря упорному труду Мавлюда сумела расширить свой товарооборот.   По бизнесу ей помогает ее дочь,а сыновья и муж ремонтируют частые дома.  На полученные доходы они вместе отремонтировали свой дом, а также  Мавлюда и ее муж женили двоих сыновей.   Мавлюда уже 5 лет кредитуется в организации "Арванд" и в течении кредитования ни разу не нарушала условия кредитовании. Мавлюда хочет привести новый ассортимент   товара и увеличить товарооборот, поэтому она хочет получить кредит и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is 53 years old and a responsible and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. In 1992 Mavlyuda started her business of selling household products. Thanks to persistent work Mavlyuda was able to expand her turnover. Her daughter helps her with the business, and her son and husband repair private homes. For the income received they together renovated their house, and further Mavlyuda and her husband married two sons away. 

Mavlyuda has been taking loans from the organization "Arvand" for 5 years already, and in this period she has never broken the loan terms. Mavlyuda would like to get a new assortment of goods and increase turnover, and therefore she would like to receive a loan. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase household goods for selling

loans.name: Yass Malgre Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA  est responsable du  groupe YASS MALGRE. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgés a 06 ans. Tous les  03 enfants vont  à l’école et elle a (03) personnes  en charge.
