texts.es: Don Encarno es una persona joven y muy trabajadora hace 12 años que vive en la zona, estudio hasta primaria vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos a los que ayuda y apoya en su educación, con el trabajo diario que realiza él es carpintero y también motosierrista, intercala su trabajo dependiendo de la demanda que tiene es muy conocida en la zona y mucha gente solicita sus servicios por ser una persona responsable, tiene bastante experiencia en ambos rubros desde niño se busco la vida de manera independiente, no cuenta con sus propias maquinas de trabajo a excepción de una motosierra, pero si tiene mucha ganas de trabajar indica su vecino que también es carpintero, actualmente su única herramienta de trabajo tiene algunos desperfectos mecánicos y le urge comprar una nueva motosierra así podrá prestar sus servicio de forma regular y podrá volver a tener los mismo ingresos de antes.
texts.en:
Encarno is a young, hardworking individual who has been living in this area for the last 12 years.  He studied through grade school, is in a relationship, and has four children whom he helps and supports with their education.  He makes a living as a carpenter and a is very good with a chainsaw.  He manages his work depending on the demand in any given moment.  He is very well known in his area and many people seek his services because he is responsible.  

He has a lot of experience in many areas.  Even as a childe he strived for ways to be independent.  His best tool is his chainsaw.  His neighbor, also a carpenter, mentions that Encarno really likes to work.  Currently, Encarno's only tool is damaged and he needs to purchase a new chainsaw so that he can get back to work and generate revenue as he was doing before.

loans.use: to purchase a chainsaw.

loans.name: Deici Vicenta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Deisi, tiene  57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene siete hijos,  seis de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudia en el colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es maestro en una escuela de la localidad.

Doña Deisi es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar a su esposo se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella  tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual realiza sus ventas, la mayor parte de sus ventas son a través  pedidos  que sus clientes realizan con anticipación. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  se la trae desde Perú o Colombia, son 17 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior, pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta la facilidad de los pagos. 

Su sueño es tener un gran almacén.
texts.en:
The communal bank Soraya meets every two weeks in Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which is recognized nationally and internationally; a place known for its famous Panama hats. Deici lives here. She is 57 years old, married and has seven children, six of whom are older and the youngest, 16, studies in school, three of her children still live with her. Her husband is a teacher in a local school.

Deici is a very good housewife and earns her own income and with this she helps her husband. She sells all types of clothing. She has a small place in her house where she makes her sales. The majority of her sales are through customer orders made in advance. She works every day; her customers pay on credit and pay every two weeks. Her merchandise is brought from Peru and Colombia. She has been doing this for 17 years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy undergarments, pants, shirts, blouses and children’s clothing. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes the ease of the payments.

Her dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, pants, shirts, blouses and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Ricsy Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Soraya se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ricsy, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 11 años que  estudian en colegio y  escuela. Su marido está en el extranjero.

La señora Ricsy es una mujer muy trabajadora que el gusta ganar sus propios recursos para no depender de nadie, ella tiene un local en el cual presta el servicio de cabinas telefónicas y allí mismo vende tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, también tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales vende ropa de todo tipo, aunque dos días por semana sale a recorrer puerta a puerta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 22h00, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, la ropa  va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita,  son 6 años que se dedica a estas actividades y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho.
 
Su meta es tener un bar o una discoteca.
texts.en:
The communal bank Soraya meets every two weeks in Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts which are recognized nationally and internationally; a place known for its famous Panama hats. Ricsy lives here. She is 35 years old and is in a common-law relationship which she has two children ages 14 and 11 who attend school. Her husband is abroad.

Ricsy is a hardworking woman who likes to earn her own income so that she doesn’t need to depend on anyone. She has an establishment where she provides telephone service booths and sells telephone cards as well she has a shop window where she sells all kinds of clothing even though twice a week she sells door to door. She works every day from 8am to 10pm; her merchandise is purchased on credit and paid for every two weeks. She buys the clothes in Guayaquil whenever she needs it. She has been doing this for 6 years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses and phone cards. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because the loans help her a lot.

Her goal is to have a bar or a nightclub.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses and telephone cards.

loans.name: Dúo Jazmin Group

texts.es: Dúo Jazmín, integrado por doña Bonifacia que se dedica a la venta de lácteos en la aldea Chixoles, Santiago Sac,  desde hace 16 años, vende todos los días de lunes a domingo en las  mañanas su esposo es quien hace las entregas en la aldea y también en el pueblo, tiene clientela fija y gracias a eso a podido aumentar su negocio ahora también hace Queso y también requesón, ahora quiere refinanciar para comprar otro ganado ya que una de sus vacas va a tener su cría y necesitan reposarla hasta que el ternero tenga dos meses y sin la vaca la producción bajaría,.
texts.en:
Dúo Jazmín includes Bonifacia who has made a living selling dairy products in the village of Chixoles, Santiago, Sacatepequez, for 16 years. She makes sales everyday, Monday through Friday in the mornings. Her husband makes the deliveries in the village as well as in the town. She has a loyal clientele and thanks to this, she has been able to expand her business. Now she also makes cheese and cheese curd.

Now she wants to refinance to buy more livestock as one of her cows is going to have a calf and she needs to let her rest until the calf is two months old. Without this cow her production would decrease.

loans.use: to buy livestock (cows).

loans.name: Cruz Orfelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar rodeada de muchos cerros.

En este lugar vive la señora Cruz, tiene 66 años de edad, está separada pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace varios años atrás, los dos que aun están vivos son mayores e independientes y viven cerca de su casa.

La señora Cruz para ganar su sustento diario con el fruto de su trabajo puso un pequeño bar en su casa en la cual vende golosinas, helados, sodas, corviches, empanadas y jugos naturales, ella trabaja todos los días en su negocio desde hace 20 años y fue con esto que pudo sacar adelante sola a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, golosinas, bocadillos y víveres. Lleva más de tres años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez para recibir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the communal bank Constructoras Del Éxito (Successful Builders) meet every two weeks. This city is long known by the name of Ciudad del Valle (City of the Valley) because it’s surrounded by many hills.

Cruz lives her. She is 66 years old and is separated and has three children from this relationship however, one child died several years ago; the two who are living are older, independent and live near her.  Cruz, to earn her livelihood from the fruits of her labour, put a small bar in her house where she sells candy, ice cream, sodas, corviches (dish made from green bananas and fish), empanadas, and fresh juice. She has been working every day for 20 years and this was how she was able to raise her children alone.

This loan is to buy sodas, candy, snacks and provisions. She has been in the communal bank for three years and she likes how quickly she receives the loans.

Her dream is to be healthy in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy sodas, candy, snacks and provisions.

loans.name: Gloria Maribel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo en un sector conocido como Las Piedras porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.

En este lugar  vive la señora Gloria, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, de 11, 9, 6 y de 2 años, los tres mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es taxista.

Hace algunos años la señora Gloria aprendió belleza y arreglo personal en una academia en el cantón El Carmen. Ella es una muy buena madre que además de atender su hogar se dedica a realizar trabajos de belleza y arreglo personal, sus clientes llegan hasta su casa  para que le realice trabajos como pintado de uñas,  cortes de cabello y tinturados, aunque la mayor parte de sus trabajos los realiza a domicilio.  Con los créditos que ha ido recibiendo ha podido comprar las herramientas necesarias para dar un buen servicio por lo cual es muy solicitada, ella también vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) cuando realiza sus trabajos. Lleva más de 8 años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar productos de Yanbal, tintes, esmaltes y otros materiales para su trabajo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran  salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Caminantes de Cristo (Travelers in Christ) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras. This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

This is where Gloria lives. She is 30 years old, she is married and she has four children aged 11, 9, 6 and 2, and the first three go to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

A few years ago, Gloria studied beauty consultation and personal makeover in an academy of the El Carmen canton. She is a good mother who, on top of caring for her family also engages in offering beauty consultations and personal makeover services. Her customers come to her house to receive beauty treatments such as nail varnishing, haircuts, hair coloring, even though she manly works at her customers’ houses. Thanks to the loans she has already received she has been able to buy the tools she needs to provide the good service she is now renown and requested for. She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies) while doing her beauty job. She has benne engages in this activity for more than 8 years and things are going very well.

She is requesting a new loan to buy Yanbal products, hair dyes, nail varnishes and other items for her activity. She has been a member of her Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it for the benefits she receives from the institution.

She dreams of owning a big beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy Yanbal products, hair dyes, nail varnishes.

loans.name: Deysi Isabel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo un el sector conocido como Las Piedras porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.

En este lugar vive la señora Daysi, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de cinco años que está en primer año de educación básica. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
La señora Deysi es una mujer muy trabajadora pues ella trabaja de asistente contable en una pequeña empresa de la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa por catálogo y productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja de tres a cuatro días pero por las noches, también vende en su lugar de trabajo a sus compañeros, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene cinco años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un local.
texts.en:
The Wayfarers of Christ Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo in the sector known as Las Piedras (The Rocks) because it is very close to a few rock quarries. 

Deysi, who is 28 years old, lives in this place. She is married and from that relationship they have a five-year-old son who is in his first year of elementary school. Her spouse is a shopkeeper. 
 
Deysi is a very hardworking woman as she works as an assistant accountant in a small business in the city. She also makes a living in commerce, selling clothing by catalog and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She sells door to door and she works three or four days but at night. She also sells to her coworkers at her workplace. She accepts credit for her products and charges every two weeks. She has been making a living in this activity for five years and it is going very well for her.
 
This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, and cosmetics among other things. She has been with the Communal Bank for three years and she likes it because of the help it offers her with loans. 
 
Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Angeles Ines

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo un el sector conocido como Las Piedras porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.
 
La señora Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica al comercio para poder ganar algo por su cuenta y así ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos de sus estudios, ella vende ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon y Sayson (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  trabaja todos los días en las tardes o cuando puede, deja a crédito y cobra todos los fines de semana, lleva más de 12 años con este negocio por lo cual tiene mucha clientela.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de cuatro años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Caminantes de Cristo communal bank meets every 15 days in the outskirts of Portoviejo.  They meet in an area that is known as Las Piedras [The Stones] because it is very close to the rock quarries.

This is where Ángela, age 37, lives.  She is married and has three children, ages 17, 15, and 13, and the children go to school.  Her husband is a merchant.  Ángela is a very hard-working woman.  She devotes herself to commerce in order to be able to earn something on her own.  She does this to help her children with their educational expenses.

She sells clothes by catalog and Avon and Sayson products (beauty products, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door, and she works every day in the afternoons or when she can.  She gives credit, and she collects on the week-ends.  She has been in this business for over 12 years; therefore she has a lot of clientele.

She will use this loan to buy clothes, perfume, and creams, among other things that she sells.  She has been in the communal bank for over four years, and she likes it because she has been able to finance her business with the loans.

Her dream is to see her children finish their education and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfume, and creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish building the exterior of his house and to put a wall around the house.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo se reúne cada quince días en las afueras de Portoviejo un el sector conocido como Las Piedras porque está muy cerca de unas canteras de roca.

En este lugar vive la señora Nelly Del Carmen, tiene 45 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Nelly Del Carmen para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios). También trabaja desde las 6h30 en una casa como empleada domestica pero en las tardes se dedica a recorrer con sus productos por toda la localidad donde vive, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva más de 11 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos y cremas. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que ha recibido de la institución.
  
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Caminantes de Cristo (Travelers in Christ) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the outskirts of Portoviejo in a sector known as Las Piedras. This place is known because it’s near a rock quarry, hence its name.

This is where Nelly Del Carmen lives. She is 45 years old, she is married and she has three adult children who are attending university and who still live at home. Her husband is a mason.

In order to support her children’s education costs and to help her husband paying for their household expenses, Nelly engages in selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and accessories for ladies). On top of this, she works as a maid in a house from 6.30 am, while in the evenings she sells her beauty products traveling around the community where she lives. She sells on credit and collects from her customers every weekend; she has been engaged in this activity for more than 11 years and things have been going very well.

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams. She is a founding member of her Communal Bank and she likes it because of the help she has received from the institution.

She hopes that her children will become professionals.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a concrete floor

loans.name: María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora  María, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 14 y 12 años de edad, todos sus hijos aun viven con ella y dos de ellos  estudian en  colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.

Doña María realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo el mismo que se dedica a la venta de pescado, su esposo se desplaza por toda la ciudad vendiendo sus productos en un triciclo de su propiedad, los mismos que en la madrugada compra en la ciudad de Manta a pescadores que llegan hasta las playas de esa ciudad,  él tiene cerca de 11 años dedicado a esta actividad y es como ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado para la venta diaria. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les brindan estos créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para recorrer con sus productos a otras partes más alejadas.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes Communal Bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

This is where María lives. She is 40 years old, she is married and she has four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 12. All of her children live at home, and two go to school. Her husband is a retailer.

María is requesting a loan in order to help her husband, who is a fishmonger. He travels around their town to sell his products with a three-wheel bike that he owns. He buys fish in the morning in the town of Manta form fishermen coming to the beaches of said town. He has been engaging in this activity for about 11 years, and tanks to this job he has succeeded in providing for their family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fish to sell on a daily basis. She is a founding member of her Communal Bank and she likes it because of the support has received through the loans, as they have helped her getting ahead.

She dreams of buys a van to reach further areas where to sell their products.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Matilde Flora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Matilde, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi.

Doña Matilde es una muy buena  ama de casa que para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto aportar a los gastos que genera el hogar desde hace más de cuatro años y con los ahorros que tenia puso una copiadora en su  casa, allí ella también vende helados, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en su negocio y tiene muchos clientes que a diario se dan cita en su local ya sea para sacar copias o para disfrutar de un delicioso helado, como su casa está cerca de un colegio sus ventas siempre son muy buenas.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar papel, gaseosas, jugos y helados para surtir su negocio está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener muy buena salud.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its traditional craftmanship which is recognized at a national and international level. It is the place of the famous straw Panama hats. 

Matilde lives here. She is 60 years old and married. From that relationship they have five children who are already adults, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband works in the Montecristi mayor's office. 

Matilde is a very good homemaker. In order to earn on her own and with that be able to contribute to the expenses the household generates, she took the savings that she had and more than four years ago she put a photocopier in her house. She also sells ice cream, juice, and soft drinks among other things. She works in her business every day and she has many customers who go to her store daily whether it be to make copies or to enjoy a delicious ice cream. Because her house is close to a high school her sales are always good.  

She will use this loan to buy paper, soft drinks, juice, and ice cream to supply her business. Since the beginning she has been with the Communal Bank and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers.
 
Her dreams are to continue being successful in her business and to have very good health.

loans.use: to buy paper, soft drinks, juice and ice cream.

loans.name: Esterella

texts.en:
Estrella is a hog raiser who lives in the village of San Francisco. She is 53 years old and is married with three children. 

Estrella has been engaged in her business for five years and earns about PHP 2,500 per piglet. Estrella is now asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccine for the proper growth of her business. 

Estrella believes that through patience and hard work, her family will survive poverty.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for the proper growth of her business.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is from the village of San Francisco, a place where he generates income by raising hogs. He usually earns about 2,500 PHP per piglet. Domingo is willing to work hard to lift his family from poor living conditions. Domingo wants another hog to raise, and is asking for a loan of 14,000 PHP. This will buy the additional hog and feed for all his hogs. Domingo believes that through this loan, he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional hog and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio is 47 years old and is married with six children. They live in the village of San Francisco. 

Dionicio is willing to work hard to lift up his family from poverty.  That's why he engaged himself in the hog raising business. He has been in his business for seven years and earns about PHP 7,500 per hog every time he sells one.  At this time, Dionicio is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins to ensure the proper growth of his hogs. 

Dionicio hopes to boost up his business to secure his family living situation.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins to ensure the proper growth of his hogs.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla is a citizen residing in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia. She is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, one (a son) of whom is dependent on her and currently in school. Phalla earns her living through farming rice and raising pigs, the businesses in which she has been involved for more than 10 years, earning around 26,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 13,000 KHR after offsetting her daily cost of living. Phalla, a seventh-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is leading a group member who is just a first-cycle client to apply for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. The previous loans that the group leader, Phalla, already received and successfully paid back have enabled her to send the dependent son to school and improve the family’s livelihood. Now with her requested loan portion, Phalla will buy fertilizer to support her rice field with part of her loan. The rest of her loan will be used to buy pig feed and cover household expenses. Phalla’s hope in the future is that her current businesses, rice growing and pig raising, will run smoothly so that she can boost her income and save some of the profit to keep her son in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Ms Sobia is 25 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for six years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Sobia was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. Due to limited resources, none of their three sons was sent to school. Sobia felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home when her husband married again and stopped providing for his family. She is a brave woman and her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf. She has requested RS 25,000 to purchase a new stitching machine, some thread with packs of laces and buttons. She hopes to earn more net income, which she will use for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine, thread, lace and buttons.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1991. She has two children. Her son is two years old. Her daughter is three months old. Her husband is a driver. His income is about 7,000,000 VND. Hai grows rice and raises chickens to earn a living. She gets about 3,000,000 VND per month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She joined SEDA's credit program in 2012. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. She wants to use the profits to raise her children well.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: As a resident of a rural area of Dambae district located in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Touch is 44 years of age and married with three children, one (a son) of whom is still dependent on her. The other two children are assisting in the family's businesses, which are growing rice and planting cassava. Touch earns around 16 USD per day through the current businesses and manages to save approximately 6 USD for future needs after deducting her daily cost of living. This will be Touch's second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The first loan that she already received and completely repaid has helped her better support her family. She is now applying for a USD 1,200 loan to spend on buying fertilizer and covering the cost of labor. With the help of this loan, she expects a boost in the family's income as well as an increase in the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Niaz

texts.en: Ms Niaz is a 43-year-old married woman. Five years ago, she took a courageous and unconventional decision to start her own business of waste management by cleaning bottles. She collects bottles in different sizes, cleans them finely and afterwards, resells them for further use. People living in her community prefer to buy from her. Despite numerous challenges, she didn’t lose faith. Hoping to develop her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor. Niaz is a mother of 10 children and she struggles tirelessly to provide a better standard of living for them. She has gradually improved her business and now has requested a loan of RS 20,000 so she can purchase more cleaning materials such as chemicals like bleach solution, brushes and packs of baking soda. She intends to use the earned profits to expand her business and hence, better support the needs of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase more cleaning materials such as bleach solution, brushes and packs of baking soda.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem, 36, is a married woman. Five years ago, she started her own business of making sehra. The sehra is a veil of flowers that a groom wears on his face as he approaches his bride. Her product has a seasonal demand, but that doesn’t stop her from conducting business. She learned the art of making sehra from her father and is proud of it. When Naseem told her family that she wanted to sell her sehrras in the market, everyone supported her because they had seen her father make money out of it. She has 3 children and is happy to be sending the eldest son to school and her younger daughter to an embroidery stitching center. She has gradually improved her business and has requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase material such as cardboard, glittering paper, ribbons and artificial flowers. She intends to use the earned profits to fund her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase material such as cardboard, glittering paper, ribbons and artificial flowers.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem, 45, is a confident and independent woman. She is a responsible mother of 5 sons and 2 daughters. Her husband is jobless. Her elder son is abroad.

She doesn't have enough money to provide education for all of her children; therefore, only one of her children is enrolled in a private school. Naseem herself is an efficient and hardworking tailor.

Since 2004, she has been running a small tailoring business in her home. She provides tailoring services in her community. Currently, she is facing a very hard time, as her husband is jobless and she is the only breadwinner in the family. Her net income is insufficient to fulfill the needs of her family. 

As this business in the only source of income for her family, so she wants to expand it by purchasing some tailoring materials, like threads in various colors, clothes and one sewing machine. However, due to the lack of finance, she is unable to do this. 

Because of this, as a member of 6-person lending group,she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help her to increase her net income and savings.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva. She desires to provide a quality education for her children so that they can live a happy life in the future. 

Note: In the picture Naseem holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials and a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been running a cloth-trading business for the last two years. She has two children and her husband is employed in a local factory with low monthly wages, so she needs to run her own business to contribute to the family income. 

She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor. Currently, she has applied for a loan of 20000 PKR to purchase a winter collection in various designs and colors. She expects a boost in her earnings, which she will use to pay for both her home expenses and the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a winter collection in various designs and colors.

loans.name: Mavish

texts.en:
Ms Mavish is a 24-year-old lady, successfully doing business making costume jewellery for the last ten months. Her husband is not earning enough so she is helping him with the family expenses. She serves well in her community.

Currently she has received a big order to make new items like earrings and necklaces, etc. Therefore she contacted Kashf and applied a loan of Rs. 20,000. In this way, she will be able to purchase raw materials such as silver, gold, and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She is expecting boost in her net income and wishes to utilize the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making jewellery.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is from the village of Villa Flor, San Isidro. She is now 36 years old, and is married to Freddierick. The couple is thankful because they had been blessed with three children. To make a living, Liberty is busy managing their mini-grocery, which is their family source of income. Her business is located at the Alicia public market. She has been in her business for four years.

Liberty wants to have more grocery items to sell. In this regard, Liberty is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, noodles, eggs, and condiments to sell. Liberty believes that through her patience and hard work her family will survive poverty.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a farmer living in Villa Domingo with his wife Elvie and two young children. The couple manages their rice planting and harvesting business together and have been doing this for 25 years. They harvest twice a year for a yield of about PHP20,000 each harvest season. 

Nelson would like to keep making the business profitable so he can pay for his childrens' education. He is now asking for PHP30,000 to buy farm supplies (fertilizers, insecticides) used in farming. Nelson prays for his family's good health and a productive yield from the farming business so he can attain progress for the family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies (fertilizers, insecticides) used in farming

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 36-year-old confident and independent woman. She lives in a rented house with her husband and daughter in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her daughter is a graduate student while husband runs his own vegetable shop in the market. But his income is inadequate to fulfill the family needs and household expenses. Rehana herself is an efficient and hardworking tailor.

For the past 15 years, she has been running a small business in her home, providing tailoring services in her community. All of her customers appreciate her efficient and excellent skills. Her earnings are playing a vital role in the family's income so she wants to continue it in the future. She currently lacks sufficient tailoring material and her sewing machine has stopped working as well. She cannot afford to purchase the needed material to continue her tailoring business. 

Rehana, as a member of a six-person lending group, has requested for a loan from Kiva's partners BRAC Pakistan to purchase reels of thread in various colors, cloth, needles and one sewing machine. This will not only help her to continue her small tailoring business but increase her net income as well. She wants to put aside profit to save for her daughter's better future. She is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: In the picture Rehana holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en: Sana is a 36-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children and excels at sewing. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides the main source of income for the family. The man shown in the photo is Sana’s husband. He purchased a rickshaw five years ago, and now he needs to replace his auto rickshaw's body. Therefore, Sana applied a loan of 20000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to help her husband operate his business better and offer improved transport services to his passengers. Sana is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his earnings; she wishes to use them to improve her children's education.

loans.use: to replace an auto rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 30-year-old married woman with three children. She is providing the service of overlock stitching (sewing) with the help of her husband.  The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband and one of her daughters is also in the photo. The couple has machines at home they use to overlock towels. They purchase rejected towels from the market, cut them into small pieces and overlock them to smooth out the ends. They have a separate machine for towel cutting. Once the towel comes out of the overlocking machine, Samina cuts the extra threads from the towels and then packs them into bundles. Although the couple has been in the business for about 10 years now, they had to face many hurdles as financing their business was always a challenge. As their children grew up, household expenses were on the rise and injecting funds into the business was almost impossible. Samina approached Kashf five years ago and borrowed funds to save the business. Recently, she has requested for Rs. 25,000 to replace the overlock machine. In this way they will be able to provide good quality towels to her customers. She wishes to utilize part of the earned revenue on her children’s education.

loans.use: To replace the overlock (sewing) machine.

loans.name: Melati Barat 2 Group

texts.en: Titin, 45 years old, has sold crackers and cookies since 2002. She sells her goods in the kiosks near her home. So far, her business has grown and from her profit she can pay her children's school fees. She will use this loan to pay the examination fees for her children and to buy flour, eggs, butter and other ingredients for her cookies and crackers. She hopes one day she have a bakery and see her children study in the university.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cookies and crackers.

loans.name: Por's Group

texts.en: Por, 60, is a mother of two children and resides in the Sangke district of Battambang province, Por works as a rice farmer to support her daily living expenses. Additionally, she raises pigs and catches fish to sell as extra income. Engaging in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn up to 15,300 KHR per day. Por is in a two-member group that is a first-time client with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). Both members are seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, Por is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer, pig feed, a fishing outfit and a fishing net. She hopes that this purchase will help her to support her various businesses and gain a good income to sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pig feed, a fishing outfit and a fishing net.

loans.name: Bassoum Yaam Group

texts.fr:
Mr T ABEL représente le  groupe BASSOUM YAM. Mariée, Il est père d’un  enfant. Ce dernier  ne va pas à l’école et il a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mr vend de lubrifiant (essence) depuis 02 ans.  Il s’approvisionne dans les stations en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter  20 litres d’essence.
Il  veut renforcer son activité  avec ses bénéfices. Mr ambitionne agrandir son champ d’activité et rehausser le niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. T ABEL is the representative of the group BASSOUM YAM. He is a married father of one child who does not yet attend school. He supports a total of three people. 

Mr. T Abel has been selling gasoline for two years. He buys his stock at the gas stations in the city. His customer base consists of both men and women.

He plans to buy 20 litres of gasoline. He wants to use his profits to bolster his activity. He would also like to expand his business and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy 20 litres of gasoline for resale.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Boldbaatar is 37 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in his own house in the Sainshand township of Dornogovi Province, Mongolia. His wife, Batbayar, is 39 years old and works at a weather forecasting and analysis center as an operator. His son, Chinbayar, age 20, is a university student, and his daughter, Chintsetseg, age 17, is a secondary school student. He has been driving a minivan, providing public transportation, for about ten years. He provides transportation services to foreign travelers during the summer, as well as public transportation service for local customers. He needs to repair his minivan to run his transportation service business smoothly, because lately his car has broken down several times, leading to temporary suspensions of his business. He is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to repair his car, so that he can provide transportation services smoothly and without any problems. He is an honest, responsible and hard-working person.

loans.use: to repair his car so that he can provide transportation services smoothly and without any problems.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Ms. Farzana is a 39-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support the needs of her family members. Two years ago she began doing stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house, and she uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She provides for three children. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 25,000 PKR from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials, including spools of thread, packs of lace, buttons, and zippers in various colors. It would help her to finish the orders on time, which will improve her earnings. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials, including spools of threads, packs of lace, buttons, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Manseeda's Group

texts.en:
Manseeda is a 30-year-old, confident and independent woman, and the mother of two sons and two daughters. She is living in a rented house with her family, in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a taxi driver, but his income is inadequate to fulfill the family needs and household expenses. 

Manseeda herself is an efficient and hard-working tailor. For the past six years she has been running a small tailoring business in her home. She provides tailoring services in her community. All of her customers appreciate her, for her efficient and excellent skills. Her income is playing a vital role in the family's income, so she wants to continue it in the future as well.

But currently her tailoring stock is not enough, and her sewing machine has stopped working. Therefore, she is unable to continue her business. She lacks the money she needs, to buy the things she requires to resume her business. For that, as a member of this six-person lending group Manseeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase spools of thread in various colors, cloth, needles, and one sewing machine. This will not only help her to resume her small business, but also to increase her net income. With the profit amount, she wants to put aside some savings for her daughters' better future. Note: In the picture, Manseeda holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and some tailoring materials, for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Muqdaas

texts.en: Mrs Muqdaas is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 12 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good customer list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Muqdaas is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use her profits to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Mrs Nasreen is a 41-year-old lady. She has been running a tailoring business for the past 20 years. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses for women. She has six children. They are all studying in school level. Her husband's income is insufficient to provide all the necessities to his family members. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 15,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, lace, zippers, etc. This will help Nasreen to create a means of increasing her revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier income. She desires to use the earned profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, threads of different colors, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Wend La Telda Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADJARA est responsable du  groupe WEND LA TELDA. Mariée, elle est mère de trois 03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgés à 10mois. Un enfant va à l’école et elle à (05) personnes  en charge.
Mme fait la restauration  depuis 10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  60 plats d’haricot.
Elle veut s’ acquérir un terrain avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne agrandir le chiffre d’affaire de son activité et mieux aider son mari.
texts.en:
ADJARA is the leader of the WEND LA TELDA group. She is married and mother of three children. Her eldest child is 12 years old, and her youngest child is 10 months old. One of her children goes to school, and she has five people living in her care.

ADJARA has been running a restaurant for ten years now. She stocks up in the provinces. Her customers are men, women, and children. She wants to buy 60 platefuls of beans.

ADJARA wants to use her profits to buy a plot of land. She is striving to grow the sales revenue of her business and help out her husband more.

loans.use: to buy 60 platefuls of beans

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en: Shagufta is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the loving mother of five children. She decided to work with her husband to contribute to the family income. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. Nowadays she is facing difficulties in meeting orders on time due to a shortage of stitching material. Due to her trust in Kashf Foundation, she applied for a repeat loan of Rs 10,000. It would help her to purchase stitching material such as spools of threads with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in different colors.  She wishes to utilize part of the profits to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material such as spools of threads with packs of buttons, laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Kirn

texts.en: Ms. Kirn is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been doing stitching work for many years. Her husband is employed in a small general store and earns insufficient income to meet the needs of the family members. This compelled her to initiate her own business to contribute to the family's income. Her husband also encouraged her to work with him for the prosperous future of their children. Kirn serves her community well. The people of her community prefer dresses from her for special occasions such as weddings, engagement parties, etc. Currently she is facing a cash problem to purchase material. For this she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR, which she plans to use with her savings to purchase more spools of thread and a new sewing machine for her sister-in-law to assist her in completing orders on time. She is hopeful to get a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: To purchase more spools of threads and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Ms. Rashida is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small business of clothes selling at her home for the last ten years. 

She offers various kinds of clothes such as fancy, casual and formal, by taking into account the taste and choices of her customers. Most of her clients are her neighbors, and in time Rashida will become famous in her community through her great collection. 

Her husband is a tailor and earns insufficient income to cover the everyday expenditures of the household alone. Rashida is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more variety of clothes in different colors and designs to add to her current ones. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy more variety of clothes in different colors and designs to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Ms. Khadija is a 37-year-old married woman. Eleven years ago she began sewing work in her house. She had the sewing machine, which she got in dowry. She sews for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

She very well knows the techniques of sewing and making her customers happy and satisfied. By this time, she has become famous in her community and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of three and wants to fulfill all their basic necessities through all her hard work. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has requested Rs. 15,000 from Kashf. This would help her to purchase more spools of thread and packs of buttons and needles. 

Khadija desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Song Ti Manague Group

texts.fr:
Mme HORTENSE est responsable du groupe  SONT TI MANAGUE. Mariée, elle est mère de six(06) enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgés à 08ans. Trois (03) vont  à l’école et elle a 03personnes  en charge.
Mme vend du jus et de l’eau fraiche et parallèlement du bois de chauffe depuis 05 ans.  Elle s’approvisionne aux  marchés  de son secteur. Ses clients sont les habitants de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  un demi-sac de sucre, 20 plats de petit mil, 10 plats de bissap et 02 plats de gingembres.
Elle  veut renforcer  son activité avec ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. Hortense is the leader of the "Sont Ti Manague" group. She is married and has six children. The oldest is 27 and the youngest is 8. Three of them attend school, and Ms. Hortense has three people in her care.
Ms. Hortense has sold juice and fresh water, as well as firewood, for five years. She gets her supplies at the markets in her area. Her customers are the people who live in her area.
She would like to buy half a bag of sugar, 20 plates of pearl millet, 10 plates of hibiscus, and 2 plates of ginger.
She would like to strengthen her business with her profits. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy half a bag of sugar, 20 plates of pearl millet, 10 plates of hibiscus, and 2 plates of ginger.

loans.name: Nisar

texts.en:
Nisar is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small bakery in her community for the last three years. She offers various bakery items such as biscuits, cupcakes, bread rolls, etc. She is an expert in baking and serves her community well. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone but Nisar’s contribution to the family income is enough to give them a decent life. 

She is the mother of five children. She is motivated to provide the basic necessities to her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to increase her stock of bread and flour and more packs of oil at wholesale rates from the market. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to expand her supplies to the local market.

loans.use: to increase her stock of bread and flour and more packs of oil.

loans.name: Andrés Felipe

texts.es:
Andrés Felipe de 31 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar en su tienda de barrio, que adquirió con el esfuerzo diario de su trabajo, y que busca consolidar con el crédito que hoy solicita para adquirir más surtido y poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Su esposa por su parte, dedicada al cuidado de sus dos hijos, ha sido su pilar, debido al gran apoyo que cada día le brinda, con el fin de que el negocio obtenga una rentabilidad que permita garantizarles a sus pequeños de tres y cinco años un buen desarrollo en su entorno social,

Andrés es un gran visionario, pues sueña con ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles a su familia una vida digna y sobre todo una excelente educación a sus hijos a través de su oficio.
texts.en:
Andrés Felipe is 31 years old and makes a living selling basic products in his neighborhood store. He acquired the store through his daily effort working and he wants to strengthen it with a loan that he is requesting today to purchase more stock so he can satisfy the needs of his customers. 

For her part, his wife spends her time caring for their two children. She has been his pillar of support through the great support she gives him everyday. This has resulted in his business being profitable that allows them to guarantee their children (three and five years old) good development in their social environment. 

Andrés is a great visionary. His dream is to expand his business and give his family a dignified life and above all, give his children an excellent education via his work.

loans.use: to purchase stock to expand his store.

loans.name: Sonia Luque

texts.es:
La socia Sonia Luque tiene 44 años de edad,es soltera y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al ngeocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,casacas y chompas y tambien la socia vende productos de belleza como lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,la socia ya tiene 6 años en estos negocios y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa y los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,polos y chompas y tambien para comprar lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia Luque is 44 years old, is single, and has three children. She makes a living selling clothing. She sells pants, jackets, and sweaters as well as selling beauty products like lipsticks, crams and perfumes. She has worked as this business for six years and it is going very well. 

Her dream is to have a storefront where she can sell clothing and beauty products. She is requesting a loan to purchase pants, t-shirts, and sweaters as well as lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. 

She is happy with the loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, and sweaters, as well as to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Maria Luisa tiene 50 años de edad,es soltera y tiene 4 hijos,la socia trabaja en el negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas y tejidos,ella lleva a lugares como Pisaq,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tiene 8 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tejidos y mantas.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado ys e compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maria Luisa, 50, is single and has four children. She works selling artisan crafts. She sells blankets and fabrics, which she takes to places like Pisaq. She works from eight in the morning until six at night. She has been in this business for eight years. Her dream is to expand her crafts business. She is applying for the loan to buy fabrics and blankets. Maria Luisa is happy with the loan she has been granted and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric and blankets

loans.name: Zoila Monica

texts.es:
La socia Zoila Monica tiene 44 años de edad,es soltera y tiene 3 hijos,la socia tiene un negocio de venta de juguetes,peluches y ropa,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de juguetes,peluches y ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar juguetes y peluches.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Zoila Monica is 44 years old, single, and has three children. She has a business that sells toys, stuffed animals, and clothing. She works from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm. She has been in business for seven years and things are going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business, and she is requesting this loan to purchase toys and stuffed animals.

This member is happy with her loan and promises to pay her installments.

loans.use: to purchase toys and stuffed animals.

loans.name: Elsa Renne

texts.es:
Elsa es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es padre y madre para su hijo; lamentablemente Elsa no pudo estudiar una carrea profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciática propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Elsa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, postres y pan, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque cuenta con buenos clientes que siempre acuden a ella.
Elsa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como frutas y abarrotes en general, de esta manera Elsa tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas, así pues Elsa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder ampliar su negocio y tener su local propio.
texts.en:
Elsa, 46, lives in the city of Chiclayo with her little boy, whom she loves and is her principal motivator in life. She's a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to getting her little boy ahead, since she is mother and father to her son; unfortunately, Elsa wasn't able to pursue a university degree as she had to help her parents with the household expenses; she would have liked to have studied nursing. In her free time she likes to watch television and sometimes she cooks a delicious meal of duck with rice for her family. 

By her own initiation, with much determination and enthusiasm, Elsa works in her kiosk selling fruit, desserts and bread. She works every day from early in the morning and works for about 6 hours. She enjoys her work and thinks it's going well because she counts on her good clients who always go to her. 

She is very thankful for the Kiva lenders. With their help, she can buy merchandise for her business, like fruits and groceries. That way, her business will be better stocked and she'll be able to increase sales. And she'll also be able to continue working and making an effort to reach her big dream of expanding her business and having her own store.

loans.use: buy merchandise like fruits and groceries.

loans.name: Silvia  Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE,el banco esta situado en la provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.
La socia Silvia tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias realizando encuentas para una empresa privada ,a la vez la socia se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia,la socia siembra lo que son papa,maiz entre otros para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia lleva buen tiempo realizando estas actividades siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante .
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de algunos productos de primera necesidad como leche y arroz para su consumo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Silvia belongs to the communal bank San Isidro de Compone. The bank is located in Anta Province, Cusco Department. Silvia is 27 and single. In addition to her daily activities, she carries out surveys for a private company. She also works in agriculture and ranching. She plants potatoes, corn, and other crops, and then later distributes them to customers who come to her. She has been doing these jobs for awhile, since they are the way that she moves forward. She is applying for a loan to buy some basic goods like milk and rice for her own use. She is grateful for the loan granted and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy staples like milk and rice for her own use.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia continua en el banco comunal Santa Rosita de Lima y con el negocio de venta de productos dormitorios, tales como sábanas, fundas de almohadas, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella va a usar su préstamo para comprar más productos para vender como sabanas y colchas. Lucia aprecia y agradece por el préstamo y se compromete a realizar los pagos mensuales a tiempo.
texts.en: Lucia is continuing in the Santa Rosita de Lima communal bank and with her business selling products for the bedroom such as sheets, pillowcases, etc. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years, and it is going very well for her. She will use her loan to buy more products to sell, such as sheets and bedspreads. Lucia appreciates and is grateful for the loan, and she is committed to making her monthly payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell, such as sheets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Luz Eneidi

texts.es:
Luz Eneidi es un gran ejemplo de esfuerzo y valentía, para su familia y las personas que la conocen, desde su juventud se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa interior y pijamas, oficio que le ha permitido aportar para las obligaciones de su familia y crear una pequeña empresa ubicada en la sala de sus casa.

Eneidi tiene un sueño que hoy comienza hacer realidad, tener una máquina lifeteadora que le permita transformar sus telas con mayores índices de calidad proporcionando valor agregado a su trabajo y generando mayores ingresos, es por esto que recurre a la solicitud de un crédito que le permita adquirir la maquinaria e invertir en insumos, debido a que no cuenta con recursos propios para realizar esta inversión a su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Eneidi is a great example of effort and valor for her family and those who know her. Since her youth, she has been designing under wear and pajamas, which has allowed her to help with the household expenses and create a small business in her home.

Eneidi has a dream that she's making a reality today: to own an overlock sewing machine that will enable her to transform her fabrics adding quality and value to her work, which will in turn generate more income. She is requesting a loan that will permit her to buy the machinery and invest in materials, as she doesn't have her won capital to invest in her business.

loans.use: buy materials and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Janice

texts.es:
La socia Janice tiene 36 años de edad,es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia trabaja como profesora del nivel inicial,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia trabaja ya tiene 5 años,el sueño de la socia es terminar de construir su casa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar materiales de construccion como cemento,yeso y arena para construir su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janice, 36, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She is a 1st grade  teacher, working from 8am until 1pm. She's been teaching for 5 years. Her dream is to finish building her house.
She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, like cement, plaster and sand to build her house. She is thankful for the loan and promises to pay her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, like cement, plaster and sand to build her house.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
La socia Marilu tiene 33 años y es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al ngeocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende perfumes,cremas,lapiz labiales y esmaltes de uñas,la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como amigas y publico en general,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Marilu is 33 years old and married with two children. She works selling beauty products such as perfume, creams, lipstick, and nail polish. She is self employed and takes her merchandise to different locations, selling to friends and the general public. This member works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and has been in business for seven years now. Business is going very well for her. Her dream is to own a store where she could sell her beauty products. 

This member is requesting a loan to purchase creams, perfumes, and lipsticks. She is happy with this loan and promises to comply with her payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia Lucrecia tiene 40 años de edad,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de pescado,la socia vende en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 1 año este negocio y el va muy bien,antes la socia se dedicaba al negocio de alquiler de moto hacia lugares de mazuco que queda localizado en la selva pero no le fue muy bien porque gastaba mucho combustible y no le alcanzaba el dinero,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de pescado.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pescado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Lucrecia is forty, married, and has three children.  She has a business selling fish.  She sells in the market from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m.  She has had this business for one year, and it is going very well.  She used to rent a motorcycle to go to places in Mazuco, which is in the jungle, but it didn't go very well because she used a lot of gas and her money didn't cover this expense.  Her dream is to expand her fish-selling business.  She is requesting a loan to be able to buy fish.  She is happy because of the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa y con la venta de comida. Ella tiene un restaurante pero el local es alquilado. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, verduras y otras cosas más. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues on in the communal bank of Asociación Arariwa as well as selling food. She has a restaurant but the storefront is rented. 

She is requesting the the loan to purchase supplies, for example, sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, and other things. She is happy with the loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sacks of rice, sugar, vegetables, and other things.

loans.name: Katherine Yanet

texts.es:
La socia Katherine Yanet se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende cremas y perfumes,la socia ya se dedica al negocio 2 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cosmeticos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cremas y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Katherine Yanet dedicates herself to her business selling beauty products. She sells creams and perfumes. She has operated this business for 2 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell cosmetics. She is requesting the loan to buy creams and perfumes. 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy creams and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz Mary de 43 años de edad, dedicada desde su juventud a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, es una guerrera comprometida con el desarrollo de su negocio, por ello día a día se esfuerza por conseguir nuevos clientes con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos para su casa. Cuenta actualmente con una máquina y en aras de incrementar su nivel de producción solicita un préstamo para la adquisición de una resortadora.


Ella sueña con tener una vida más digna para ofrecerle a su familia, al mismo tiempo que espera ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejor calidad en su servicio.
texts.en:
Luz Mary is 43 years old and has been manufacturing clothing since she was a young woman.  She is strongly committed to the development of her business and makes a great effort to win new customers every day in order to increase her household income.  She has a sewing machine and is asking for a loan so that she can buy a restored machine that will allow her to increase production.

She dreams of having a more dignified life to provide her family, while at the same time provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dennys Eduardo

texts.es: El socio continúa con el banco comunal y con el negocio de distribución productos de snacks es decir reparte a las diferentes tiendas de abarrotes de la ciudad del Cusco pero en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio de trasporte urbano y también estudia topografía. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para pagar la matrícula del curso de topografía. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: Dennys Eduardo is continuing with the communal bank and with his business of distributing snack products.  He delivers them to various grocery stores in the city of Cusco.  In his free time, he offers an urban transportation service and also studies topography.  He needs this loan to be able to pay for a topography course.  He is happy because of the loan and promises to make all of his payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for a topography course.

loans.name: Patron San Pedro De Cuyo Chico Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN PEDRO DE CUYO CHICO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yeny ella es conviviente y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, antes la socia se dedicaba al negocio de venta de productos de belleza pero no le fue muy bien, en el negocio de restaurant la socia ya tiene 2 años, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear con sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de maíz y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the communal bank "Patron San Pedro de Cuyo Chico," which is located in the district of Calca, in the province of Calca and the department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Yeny. She is 28 years old,  lives with her partner, and has two children. She works in her restaurant business. She prepares breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. In the past she had a business selling beauty products, but it did not go very well for her. She has been in the restaurant business for two years now. In her free time she likes to go for walks with her children. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is applying for the loan to buy ingredients for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

The other members' businesses are a grocery store, selling handicrafts, selling corn, and selling animals.

Señora Yeny is grateful to those who form part of her dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Doña Mariela de 64 años de edad es una viva representación de que cuando se quiere es posible obtener lo que se sueña, desde hace doce años se ha dedicado a la costura y con su empeño a logrado crear una microempresa dedicada a la fabrican de uniformes para los colegios de su comunidad. Su propósito es poder expandir su negocio y para lograrlo solicita un préstamo que destinará a la compra de insumos y el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser, lo cual le permitirá generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Mariela is 64 years old. She is a living representation of how when one wants something it is possible to achieve what they dream for. For twelve years she has made a living at tailoring. With her hard work she has been able to create a micro business. She works making uniforms for students in her community. 

Her proposal is to expand her business and to request a loan that she will use to purchase supplies and repair her sewing machine. This will allow her to make more of an income for her home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and repair her machine.

loans.name: Stivel Alain

texts.es:
